He died alone, but his spirit still haunts crazy here and become part of the mine.

But Crimlaks guest houses is a persistent rumor that one should only can offer the old Gerren and his treacherous mine forehead and may be the greatest treasure of silver Dreientals take home, which attracts adventurers and over again to the old Spukmine.

127628.name: Morro
127628.description:
Morro is a game for two players on a square grid with white and black stones.

Definitions:
Row: any line of consecutively adjacent, like-colored stones. Rows may be oriented either orthogonally or diagonally. The length of a row is the number of stones in it.
Drop: to place a stone on any empty space.

Rules:

To start, White drops a single stone.
From then on, starting with Black, the players take turns. On your turn, you must drop a number of stones equal to the length of the longest row (of either color) on the board. If there aren’t enough empty spaces left to do so, just fill up the board.
When you create a row longer than any row created by your opponent up until that point, you become the leader.
The game ends when the board is full, and the leader at that time wins.

127629.name: Dungeons & Derringers
127629.description:
From Introduction:

An adventure for level 9-12 characters.

After many successful adventures, the players have made many powerful enemies. One such enemy has hired a band of mercenaries equipped with mysterious weapons to capture the players. After being caught in an ambush, the players wake up in prison cells…

127630.name: Sewer Rats
127630.description:
From Introduction:

An adventure for level 1-4 characters.

A local guild of thieves calling themselves the sewer rats has been causing a lot of troubles for a small city and a reward of 100 gp has been put up for whomever can put an end to this guild's activities.

127631.name: The Minotaur's Maze
127631.description:
From Introduction:

An adventure for level 5-8 characters.

A city asks the characters for help with a minotaur that terrorizes the citizens. He lives in a magical hedge maze and has made a few powerful monstrous allies. The city officials are willing to pay 500 gp if the players can kill the beast.

127632.name: Der Tempel des Blitzes
127632.description:
From Introduction:

Die Charaktere werden von Arolian Nadariel, einem Elfen, der in seiner Villa am Stadtrand der Piratenstadt Campiliona wohnt, gebeten, einen Auftrag für ihn zu erledigen. Er spricht mit ungewöhnlich tiefer Stimme.

In einem Dayna-Tempel sollen sie ein Blitzelementar vernichten, das sich bedauerlicherweise von der Seite des Lichts abgewandt habe. Als Belohnung bietet er den Charakteren einen Summe von 880 GM und diejenigen Schätze an, die sie zusätzlich in dem Tempel erbeuten können.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The characters are asked by Arolian Nadariel, an elf who lives in his villa on the outskirts of the city Campiliona pirates, complete a job for him. He speaks with an unusually deep voice.

Dayna in a temple, they will destroy a flash unit, which had unfortunately turned away from the side of light. As a reward, he offers the characters a total of 880 GM and those resources that they can also capture in the temple.

127633.name: Die Reise nach Crimlak
127633.description:
From publisher blurb:

BOCK AUF WILDNIS?

Ich habe viele Jahre hier in Sturmklippe als Krämer gearbeitet, doch jetzt zieht es mich zurück in meine Heimat - Crimlak im Dreiental. Ich weiß nicht, ob ihr je von diesem Ort gehört habt, er liegt weit im Westen, fast bei Vestrach - viele Kilometer von der Mondküste entfernt.

Mein Hab und Gut habe ich bereits vor einem Monat auf den Weg gebracht, meine Warenreste sind verkauft und die letzte Ladenmiete gezahlt - es kann also losgehen. Doch der Weg ist weit und für einen alten Mann alleine viel zu gefährlich - ich könnte waffenstarke Unterstützung gebrauchen. Darum seid Ihr hier.

"Die Reise nach Crimlak" ist ein kurzes Einführungsabenteuer für noch unerfahrene Charaktere, welches die Gruppe von Sturmklippe aus in den kühlen Nordwesten zum Dreiental geleitet, Schauplatz des Abenteuerbandes Die Minen von Crimlak. Nach Abschluss der “Reise nach Crimlak” haben die Charaktere erste Erfahrungen gesammelt, bereit dazu, sich weiteren Gefahren im Dreiental zu stellen.


Translation courtesy of Google:

BOCK TO WILDERNESS?

I've worked here for many years as a grocer in storm cliff, but now it takes me back to my homeland - in Crimlak Dreiental. I do not know if you've ever heard of this place, he is far to the west, almost at Vestrach -. Many miles from the coast Moon

My possessions I have already taken a month ago on the way, my goods are sold and remains of the last paid rent for the shop - so you can start. But the road is wide and for an old man alone, far too dangerous - I could use weapons of strong support. That is why you're here.

"The trip to Crimlak" is a short introductory adventure for inexperienced characters, which led the group by storm cliff in the cool northwest to Dreiental, scene of the adventure strip "Mines of Crimlak". After completion of the "Journey to Crimlak" the characters have gained some experience, willing to take on additional risks in Dreiental.

127634.name: Crimlak und das Dreiental
127634.description:
From publisher blurb:

SANDBOX-2-GO

Besucht das Dreiental!
Bereist den berühmten Bertelsweg, macht Halt im Sternbacher Handelsposten, trinkt ein kühles Met und hört die Legenden vom verfluchten Elfenhain, der Turmruine im Knochenwald oder den sagenumwobenen Schätzen, die in der Drachenfeste auf mutige Helden warten.

Besucht Crimlak!
Durchschreitet das Vestracher Tor, erblickt den prächtigen Tempel Helias, genießt ein köstliches Mahl in der Drachenschänke, bewundert in der Altstadt zwergische Handwerkskunst oder entspannt Euch etwas in der Talrose, werte Reisende - es liegt in Euren Händen, was Ihr hier macht.

“Crimlak und das Dreiental” ist ein Settingband für das Dungeonslayers Rollenspiel, angesiedelt im hohen Norden der Freien Lande. Dieses PDF enthält sämtliche Informationen über die Ortschaft Crimlak und ihre Umgebung aus dem Abenteuerband “Die Minen von Crimlak” in aktualisierter, überarbeiteter Form. Zusammen mit seinen vielseitigen Bewohnern, wundersamen Gerüchten und alten Geheimnissen bildet das hier vorgestellte Setting den idealen Ausgangspunkt für eigene Kampagnen in diesem rauen, kargen Landstrich im kühlen Norden der Freien Lande und dient zugleich als Hintergrundmaterial für Die Katakomben des Nekromanten und Der Kult des Roten Drachen.


Translation courtesy of Google:

SANDBOX-2-GO

Visit the Dreiental!
Visited the famous Bertelsweg makes stop in the star Bacher trading post, a cool drink mead and listen to the legends of elves cursed grove, the ruined tower in the bone or the fabled forest treasures that await them in the dragon feasts of courageous heroes.

Visit Crimlak!
By falls, the Vestracher gate, saw the magnificent temple Helias, a delicious meal enjoyed in the Dragon tavern, admired in the old dwarven craftsmanship and relax a bit in the Talrose values​​, travelers - it is in your hands, what are you doing here.

"Crimlak and Dreiental" is a setting for the band Dungeonslayers role game set in the far north of the open countryside. This PDF contains all the information about the town and its surroundings from the Crimlak adventure book "The Mines of Crimlak" in an updated, revised form. Together with its eclectic residents, wondrous rumors and old secrets is presented here setting the ideal starting point for your own campaigns in this harsh, barren landscape in the cool north of the Free country and serves as background material for "The Catacombs of the Necromancers" and "The Cult of the Red dragon. "

127635.name: Das Wissensduell: Rekorde
127635.description:
This is a trivia game with questions about records.
The game includes 100 cards with 100 Questions and answers (on the back side) and four clips in four colours used as player markers.

Players have to estimate facts for questions. There are always 10 different possible answers. There is a clip for each player to mark their answers on the card. Each spot with an answer can only be taken by one player. When all players made their estimations the card is flipped to the backside with the answer. The player with the correct answer or is closest to it gets the card. If theres a tie the next question/card is worth two cards (the old tied card and the next new card).
The first player with 7 cards is the winner.

127636.name: Sprint: Challenge
127636.description:
Lamagama Entertainment presents the game that will keep you playing over and over again!

Prepare yourself for an impossible run with overwhelming attacks of bad ninjas against our little samurai hero! Survive as long as possible by dodging sais, ninja stars, fires, traps and even bombs thrown by ninjas. Don’t miss the Power-Ups sent by DragonGod to support you! We challenge you to be the best samurai!

No one said that being a samurai will be easy!

Source: The Developer Website.

127637.name: Olympic Archery
127637.description:
Statistical replay game on olympic archery, probably the only one available on the market, it a simple dice and charts game, with data for replaying all individual archery events from 1972 to 2008.
The game works around three different tables, on which the player roll two dice to get a score for each arrow shot (or 12/18 arrows round).
It is strictly a solitare replay game

127638.name: Crossing Pawns
127638.description:
In this abstract board game, players alternate placing white and black pawns on a 4x4 grid. After each player has placed 7 pawns, a red pawn is placed on one of the two remaining spaces. The players then move their pawns, trying to get four pawns in a row across the board. The first person to get four pawns in a row wins.

This game is one of two original board games published as part of a "Free Printable Board Games" article by the Love2Know website in July 2012.

127639.name: Das Wissensduell: Dinosaurier
127639.description:
This is a trivia game with questions about dinosaurs.
The game includes 100 cards with 100 Questions and answers (on the back side) and four clips in four colours used as player markers.

Players have to estimate facts for questions. There are always 10 different possible answers. There is a clip for each player to mark their answers on the card. Each spot with an answer can only be taken by one player. When all players made their estimations the card is flipped to the backside with the answer. The player with the correct answer or is closest to it gets the card. If theres a tie the next question/card is worth two cards (the old tied card and the next new card).
The first player with 7 cards is the winner.

127640.name: Olympic Rowing
127640.description:
Statistical sport replay game on the sport of rowing, covering all rowing events in the Olympic games from 1972 to 2008. Hundreds of rowers are rated.
The game system, strictly for solitaire replay kind of play, left only a limited space to randomness: each event has an average time and player roll dice for each competitors to see how he/she/they fare against the others and the average final time. Each competitors sum up the modifiers obtained through four different dice roll to see the final result.

127641.name: Das Wissensduell: Der Menschliche Körper
127641.description:
This is a trivia game with questions about human body.
The game includes 100 cards with 100 Questions and answers (on the back side) and four clips in four colours used as player markers.

Players have to estimate facts for questions. There are always 10 different possible answers. There is a clip for each player to mark their answers on the card. Each spot with an answer can only be taken by one player. When all players made their estimations the card is flipped to the backside with the answer. The player with the correct answer or is closest to it gets the card. If theres a tie the next question/card is worth two cards (the old tied card and the next new card).
The first player with 7 cards is the winner.

127642.name: Dungeonwerk #1
127642.description:
From publisher blurb:

DURCH DIE HALLEN VON LOM-TRANAR

DUNGEONWERK #1 BEINHALTET BODENPLÄNE FÜR DAS SPIEL MIT MINIATUREN, DIE DEN SPIELERN RAUMWEISE VORGELEGT WERDEN KÖNNEN, WÄHREND SIE DIE DUNKLEN GEWÖLBE UNTER DEN RUINEN VON LOM-TRANAR ERFORSCHEN. Dungeon2Go 10: Der Zauberer von Lom-Tranar WIRD FÜR DIESES DUNGEONWERK BENÖTIGT.


Translation courtesy of Google:

THROUGH THE HALLS OF LOM TRANAR

DUNGEON PLANT # 1 INCLUDES FLOOR PLANS FOR THE GAME WITH MINIATURES TO THE PLAYERS ROOM BE PRESENTED MAY BE IN THE DARK VAULT IN THE RUINS OF LOM TRANAR ERFORSCHEN. DUNGEON-TO-GO # 10: "THE WIZARD OF LOM TRANAR" IS WORK NEEDED FOR THIS DUNGEON.

127643.name: Das Wissensduell: Autos
127643.description:
This is a trivia game with questions about cars and machines.
The game includes 100 cards with 100 Questions and answers (on the back side) and four clips in four colours used as player markers.

Players have to estimate facts for questions. There are always 10 different possible answers. There is a clip for each player to mark their answers on the card. Each spot with an answer can only be taken by one player. When all players made their estimations the card is flipped to the backside with the answer. The player with the correct answer or is closest to it gets the card. If theres a tie the next question/card is worth two cards (the old tied card and the next new card).
The first player with 7 cards is the winner.

127644.name: The Last Slice
127644.description:
This pizza-themed educational board game teaches fractions. There are seven pizzas on the table, with each pizza divided into a different number of slice pieces. Each player has a hand of four cards numbered between 1 and 8. Players use the cards to construct fractions and claim slices of pizza.

If player takes the last slice of a pizza, that player receives a "Yum!" counter. When all the pizza slices are taken, the player with the most "Yum!" counters wins.

This is one of two original board games published in July 2012 by the Love2Know Website as part of a "Printable Board Games" article.

127645.name: L'evaso
127645.description:
From the Introduction:

Questa avventura con tanto di personaggi pre-generati vuole essere un ottimo modo per scoprire la semplicità e la dinamicità del sistema di gioco di Christian Kennig. Dungeonslayers è un GdR fantasy alla vecchia maniera scaricabile gratuitamente e divulgabile secondo le norme del Creative Commons. Lo scenario qui presentato si avvale anche del supplemento Fireworks, in cui vengono introdotte alcune armi da fuoco fantasy limitate però ai Moschetti Nanici, alle Pistole ad Avancarica ed alcune curiose combi-armi.


Translation courtesy of Google (corrected by user):

This adventure, complete with pre-generated characters, is meant to be a great way to discover the simplicity and dynamism of the game system by Christian Kennig. Dungeonslayers is an old-style fantasy RPG which can be downloaded free of charge and distributed according to Creative Commons rules. The scenario presented here also makes use of the supplement Fireworks, which introduces some fantasy firearms, however limited to Dwarven Muskets, Muzzleloading Pistols and some curious combi-weapons.

127646.description:
Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.

Outrageous witch trials, wicked instruments, ghastly and catastrophic personal hygiene counts - what age could better fit to black stories as the Dark Ages? Part of the puzzles are based on historical events in this edition, some of them are from the medieval life.
127646.name: Black Stories: Mittelalter Edition

127647.description: Time's Up! La Recharge - 2012, a French language expansion for any of the various Time's Up! games, includes 110 new cards with 220 names associated with 2012, but no sand timer.
127647.name: Time's Up! La Recharge: 2012

127648.description:
Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.

These puzzles are hot: 42 cases of fatal passion, 18 disastrous affairs, 9 betrogende husbands and women, two transvestites and a bigamist: 50 raven black mystery surrounding the deadliest thing in the world!
127648.name: Black Stories: Sex and Crime Edition

127650.name: Naval War of 1812
127650.description: Naval War of 1812 showcases the global commerce war between Great Britain and the young United States. The goal of the American player is to hunt down British merchant ships while avoiding their warships. The British goal is to seek out the American frigates and merchant ships, while protecting their own. The game includes a hard mounted game board, plastic ships in four colors, and cards for ship maneuver that depict the strategic and tactical capabilities of the era.

127651.name: Slaughter at Sandy Vale
127651.description:
From Introduction:

Date farmers in the new settlement of Sandy Vale, along the edge of a desert, have been going missing. Clues in the town of Sandy Vale and the countryside lead to the pyramid shaped temple in the dunes.

boardgamehonor: 2012 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
127652.description: In this strategy game, the players are pirates who have to put their pieces one a at a time on the board. Players win a treasure by placing the 3 pieces shown on one of their treasure maps in a row. The winner is the player with the most number of precious stones.
127652.name: Pirates!

127653.name: Black Stories Junior: Das Spiel
127653.description:
Stories and adventures from the wild woods, the depths of the sea, desert and prairie, or the vastness of the universe - the board game "junior black stories - The Game" is a journey through the mysterious world for children.

With the help of cards players must solve puzzles, stories and questions: The expedition leader knows the solution of the mystery story that are made ​​with cleverly guessed yes / no questions and players need lot of fantasy.

127654.name: Monsterspielkarten
127654.description:
User summary:

A collection of creatures, formatted to be printed and cut up as cards for ease of use, for use with Dungeonslayers.

127655.name: Zombie Tsunami
127655.description:
The zombies are revolting ! Take your place in a crowd of rampaging undead as you race through the city attacking the unfortunate survivors and adding them to your unstoppable throng of hungry, hot-footed horrors. It’s a Zombie Carnaval out there, and everyone is invited!

Source: The Developer Website.

127656.name: Zauberwerk
127656.description:
From publisher blurb:

SALAKASAM!

Zauberwirker aufgepaßt – hier kommt Futter!
Dieses Ergänzungsheft beinhaltet auf magischen acht Seiten alles über ein alternatives Magie-System für das Rollenspiel Dungeonslayers.
Es wird das Wirken von Magie in jeder DS-Rundegrundlegend verändern.

Alternative Magie-Regeln: das Mana-System
die Talente Manakraft und Meditation





Translation courtesy of Google:

ALAKAZAM!

Spellcasters be very cautious - here is food!
This supplement issue includes eight pages of magic about an alternate magic system for the RPG Dungeon layer.
It is the work of magic in each DS-round change fundamentally.

Magic alternative rules: the mana system
the talents Manakraft and meditation

127657.name: Mad Dash: Canyon Run
127657.description:
The ultimate skill-based customizable runner! With over 5000 unique gear and skill combinations, discover your ultimate insane load-out.

Pazzo is a not-so-good bandit that has been left eating dust as the other members of the "Nine-o-Spades" gang have taken off with his share of the loot. Now he must chase them down as they continue their backstabbing ways. Pazzo has one advantage though... he is completely insane -giving him awesome powers to beat the looming challenges and catch those dastardly bandits.

Give Pazzo an extra edge by equipping him with gear from the huge range available, each with their own unique benefits:

Hats (Colourful items with awesome benefits, but watch out that they don't fall off),
Charms (mystical items that give Pazzo the edge that he needs),
Parchments (super powerful items that give you awesome benefits for a single run).
Encounter various hazards that each require an unique tactic to overcome: wild coyotes, deranged vultures, angry bulls, thunderous boulders, diabolical cacti and heaps more.

Inspired by the off-beat style of classic spaghetti westerns, journey into the colorful (and mad) world of Pazzo.

Original Music by award-winning composer Heath Brown, with tracks inspired by classic spaghetti western scores of the great Ennio Morricone.

Heaps of achievements and leaderboards so you can prove your mad skills to the world, along with Twitter and Facebook posting.

Eye popping graphics with full retina support on both iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch. (This game is designed for high resolution displays, although the iPhone 3GS is supported, it is not optimal for gameplay.)

With over 5000 gear and skill combinations, now you can choose your path to glory!

Source: The Developer Website.

127658.name: Kartenwerk: Die Freien Lande
127658.description:
From publisher blurb:

Diese Spielhilfe für das Dungeonslayers Rollenspiel enthält Landkarten der westlichen und östlichen Freien Lande, die idealen Begleiter für jede Caera-Kampagne.

Neben druckerfreundlichen s/w-Karten und pergamentähnlichen Varianten wurden für reiselastige Kampagnen außerdem noch Hexkarten hinzugefügt, um Entfernungen und Reisedistanzen besser abschätzen zu können.

Zusätzlich gibt es von allen Karten auch noch unbeschriftete Versionen, die den Spielern zu Erkundungszwecken ausgehändigt werden können.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This game means for the role-playing game Dungeon layer contains maps of the western and eastern open countryside, the ideal companion for every Caera campaign.

In addition to printer-friendly s / w cards and parchment-like variants were used for travel-heavy campaigns also have added Hexkarten to estimate distances and travel distances better.

In addition, there are also maps of all unlabeled versions, which the players can be given to exploration purposes.

127659.name: The Act
127659.description:
In the tradition of the world’s most classic animations comes The Act – a unique, film-quality game that lets you control 2D animated characters completely interactively.

Enter the magical world of Edgar and Sylvia – two unforgettable characters drawn together by fate and circumstance. Help Edgar - a well-meaning window washer – in his quest to rescue his brother, save his job, and romance the woman of his dreams!

Follow the characters through hilarious adventures, and across a visually-rich tapestry of scenes and scenarios. Experience the unique, adaptive musical score, and sound effects that respond directly to real-time gameplay.

With stunning visuals, a captivating storyline and simple controls, The Act is a tremendous deal of fun for anyone (6-65+ years), and an exciting new form of animated game.

Source: The Game Website.

127660.name: Kartenwerk: Das Dreiental
127660.description:
From publisher blurb:

Diese Spielhilfe für das Dungeonslayers Rollenspiel enthält die vollständigen Settingkarten aus dem Abenteuerband Die Minen von Crimlak von Moritz Mehlem. Dazu kommen auch wieder unbeschriftete Varianten, die den Spielern zu Erkundungszwecken ausgehändigt werden können, sobald sie im Dreiental unterwegs sind.
Zur besseren Orientierung gibt es die Wildniskarten (Spielleiter und Spieler) abermals auch als Hexfeldvarianten.

Als Bonus enthält dieses Kartenwerk dazu noch die Handoutbilder von Thomas “Brotkopp” Trapp aus “Die Minen von Crimlak”.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This game means for the role-playing game Dungeon layer contains the complete setting of the adventure strip maps "Mines of Crimlak" by Moritz Mehlem. To come back unlabelled versions, which the players can be given to exploration purposes as soon as they are in Dreiental go.
For better orientation, there are the wild cards (game master and player) once again as Hexfeldvarianten.

As a bonus, this book contains maps to this the Handoutbilder Thomas' bread Kopp "Trapp from" The Mines of Crimlak ".

127661.name: Sugar High
127661.description:
Biscuit is a dog unlike any other. He cares not for steaks and bones, it’s sweets and cakes that fill his dreams. As his owner’s views on healthy canine diet are conservative, sweet dreams are the only way for Biscuit to fulfill his sugary fantasy. Whenever he falls asleep, he finds himself chasing sweets down chocolate hills. As long as he can stay ahead of evil Mr. Alarm Clock, he can munch on candy to his heart’s desire. If he wakes up, the sugar high will end.

Source: The Developer Website.

127662.name: Pocket Quiz: Französisch Grammatik
127662.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

By answering the questions themselves, the students learn French language and its grammatic.

127663.name: Pocket Quiz: Französisch Aktiv
127663.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

By answering the questions themselves, the students memorize the French language.

127664.name: Dead Trigger
127664.description:
The world has collapsed.
In 2012 modern civilisation is coming to an end. Global economics have been disrupted, money has lost its value. People have risen against the ignorant politicians who were just lining their pockets – and they didn't spare any of them.
However, those who really ruled the world were prepared - and escaped, leaving billions of people to die from a strange virus, while others turned into butcherly beasts with just one thought:
TO KILL!
Only a few people on the planet have survived, at least until they run out of ammo... or learn what else they must do to stop them...
Smash hordes of bloodthirsty zombies * Secure vital supplies * Save other survivors * Protect the safe haven * Explore the city * and uncover the provoking truth in this intense FPS action game!

Source: The Developer Website.

127665.name: Codename: Outbreak
127665.description:
Game Box

During routine observation of the nocturnal sky, astronomers registered a new object in the Ursa Major constellation. According to observation data, the object was of mid-sized comet class. Moving at a tremendous speed, the guest from another galaxy could soon be seen with the naked eye in the sky at night. After verifying the calculations, state authorities began preparing for the possible catastrophe and evacuated all major cities. Humans got ready for the worst, although the worst was yet to come...


Features 14 graphically amazing single player and co-operative environments.
Select from both night and day campaigns.
Features a range of menacing teammate escorts that can be carefully selected for each of their individual abilities depending on your mission objectives.
Play in both stunning 1st and 3rd person views for maximum realism.
Extensive multiplayer features including exclusive maps, various network play options including Co-operative, Capture the Flag, Deathmatch and many more.

127666.name: Frozen Synapse: Red
127666.description:
The multi-award-winning indie strategy masterpiece is back with a brand new expansion pack!

Frozen Synapse: Red adds awesome features like co-op play against the AI and a brand new unit, as well as a selection of additional music tracks plus an exclusive single player campaign.

Features:

Full co-op for the single player campaign and all new single player content
A new unit (riot shield)
A new multiplayer game mode (“Upload”)
15 mission single player campaign
10 single player challenge missions
Three mutators (gameplay modifiers for advanced users)
6 additional music tracks by nervous_testpilot (2 previously available in the Humble Indie Bundle)
MP3 and FLAC download of all Frozen Synapse: Red music
Original music tracks “Deeper” and “Focus” unlocked during gameplay
“Impeccable Micro” - a chiptune album from _ensnare_ (MP3 and FLAC)
The infamous “Red Mode”…




Source: The Game Website.

127667.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Seekers of Knowledge, the third deluxe expansion for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game, populates the hallowed halls of Miskatonic University with nineteen different characters committed to the merits of higher education, the application of science, and a little dabbling in stranger and darker knowledge.

The host of new Miskatonic characters provides the faction dynamic new life in Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. Many of the characters work well together, gaining greater efficiency the more of their allies enter play. Other cards provide Miskatonic University players reasons to focus solely upon the heroic investigators, rather than pairing them up with another faction and compromising their ideals. Altogether, Seekers of Knowledge looks to sound the bell upon a brand new school year full of optimism.

Finally, Seekers of Knowledge is more than another deluxe expansion; it's the first in a new release model for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. The game will shift away from monthly Asylum Packs to the release of a deluxe expansion (each with 165 cards, three copies each of fifty-five individual cards) once every four months.
127667.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Seekers of Knowledge
boardgamefamily: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)
boardgamepodcastepisode: Elder Things 001

127668.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Days of Blood, the first Battle Pack from the "Eternal War" cycle for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, the cycle's new strategies arrive to the front lines with a deafening roar! The new Ambush and Raider keywords allow players to surprise their enemies and gain wealth from the bodies of the fallen. The Battle Pack's sixty cards (three copies each of twenty individual cards) also include a Dark Elf legend filled with hatred, two Fortifications, powerful new tactics, and a veteran Empire Knight who benefits from his combat experience!

Days of Blood is the first Warhammer: Invasion expansion to benefit from a new mechanism for "experience". While nearly all of the new units from the "Eternal War" cycle share abilities that lend emphasis to the Battlefield phase, some units gain experience to fuel increasingly powerful abilities every time they attack.
127668.name: Warhammer: Invasion – Days of Blood

127669.name: Lunar Flight
127669.description:
A modern take on the classic arcade game, Lunar Lander, Lunar Flight extends the experience to a fully, fictionalised Lunar Module Simulator providing a variety of mission types involving Transporting Cargo, Acquiring Data at Survey locations and locating Lost Cargo. Completing missions earns experience points and money to be used to Refuel, Repair and Upgrade the Lunar Module.

In addition to missions there are Time Trial challenges complete with Online Leader boards and a globally ranked ‘Pilots’ Leaderboard, ranked by experience.To round out the game there are a variety of Achievements to provide additional challenges and objectives.

A truly unique and challenging flight simulation experience, Lunar Flight will give you many hours of immersive, addictive & rewarding gameplay.

Lunar Flight features very atmospheric sound and visuals, creating a very immersive experience and is designed to engage the player’s senses as well as their appreciation for realistic physics. Fans of space flight will be pleased to know that it futures proper Newtonian physics behaviour and will provide one of the most authentic and dynamic space based, low gravity flight experiences they can have.

While being simulation oriented it is also designed to be accessible and fun and supports the XBox 360 controller by default but can be configured with almost any controller setup.

Source: The Game Website.

127670.name: Pocket Quiz: Deutsch für Ausländer Grammatik
127670.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "German for foreigner".

127671.name: Pitfalls & Penguins Playtest Edition
127671.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pitfalls and Penguins is a game where you and your friends will use your imagination to tell a story together.

Like many pen and paper role-playing games, the core of Pitfalls and Penguins is a book that explains all the rules, lists the funny playable classes and species, and has plenty of hilarious comics and illustrations that help you and your friends immerse yourselves in a goofy fantasy world with exotic cities like Topeka and Detroit.

127672.name: The Elder Scrolls Travels: Dawnstar
127672.description:
The Elder Scrolls Travels: Dawnstar (2004) is a role-playing video game developed exclusively for Java-enabled cell phones in the style and scope of its fellow The Elder Scrolls games.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Elder Scrolls Travels: Dawnstar," available under the CC-BY-SA License.


User Summary:

The story takes place in the northern village of Dawnstar, where the governor Vinticae wants you to find his four missing champions. You have to survive the cold glacier, and choose friends wisely, and figure out which one of the champions that is a traitor.

127673.name: Suffragettes In and Out of Prison
boardgameversion: Women's Social and Political Union edition 1908
127673.description:
Rules from game itself:

Directions for playing the Great Suffragette game:
"HOW TO GET OUT OF GAOL"

The suffragettes (i.e. the card disks) are first placed on the inner circle. (Holloway Goal).

The players alternately throw the dice, and at each throw the player moves his Suffragette round the spiral course, the same number of spaces as the number thrown.

Should a number be thrown which would bring a suffragette on to a space marked with either of the undermentioned words, she must be move as directed, viz. :-

"OPEN DOOR" The suffragette must be placed on the adjoining space in the next circle further away from the goal.

"POLICEMAN" or "WALL" The suffragette must be placed on the adjoining space in the next circle nearer to the goal.

"WARDRESS" The suffragette must be put back in Holloway Gaol and recommence her journey.

The player whose Suffragette first reaches the end of the spiral course wins the game. As a puzzle, the problem is to see what is the fewest number of throws you can get your Suffratette out of goal, following the same rules as for the game.

127674.name: The Elder Scrolls Travels: Shadowkey
127674.description:
The Elder Scrolls Travels: Shadowkey (2004) is a role-playing game developed exclusively for the N-Gage in the style and scope of its fellow The Elder Scrolls games. It is one of four mobile The Elder Scrolls games and is co-published and produced by TKO Software and Vir2L Studios, the sister company of Bethesda Softworks.

Gameplay is handled with the numeric touchpad on the right side of the N-Gage as well as the normal game action keys. Additionally, this game allowed (via Bluetooth) 2 player co-operative gameplay. The player or players could create or use characters from the Argonian, Breton, Dark Elf, High Elf, Khajiit, Imperial, Nord, Redguard, and Wood Elf races in game (These are the names used in the game manual itself). The classes available are Assassin, Barbarian, Battlemage, Knight, Nightblade, Rogue, Spellsword, Sorcerer, and Thief.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Elder Scrolls Travels: Shadowkey," available under the CC-BY-SA License.


Back of box:

Experience role-playing action at its best in this latest epic from the award winning Elder Scrolls series. Combat, magic and thief skills will help you survive and uncover the mysteries of the Shadowkey.

127675.name: Hawkeye Datafile
127675.description:
User summary:

The official datafile for Hawkeye, published as a bonus content on the publisher's website.

127676.name: The Elder Scrolls Travels: Oblivion
127676.description:
From Wikipedia: The Elder Scrolls Travels: Oblivion is an Elder Scrolls Travels game available on Java-enabled cell phones. It follows the storyline established in the console and PC versions of Oblivion, but a player does not require any previous experience with these versions to enjoy the game. Oblivion Mobile includes ten main levels and four optional quests. Eight classes are available to choose from, and each has access to different armor, weapons, and spells, as well as a number of items available to them all.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Elder Scrolls Travels: Oblivion," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127677.name: Pocket Quiz Logik-Rätsel
127677.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The ultimate knowledge-check! Test your skills on the subject of logic puzzles! Confusing and challenging puzzles to think about.

SOlve the puzzle first and get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

127678.name: Pocket Quiz: Optische Illusionen II
127678.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

Try to solve the puzzle first and find out what is hiding behind the optical illusions to get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

127679.name: Pocket Quiz: Optische Illusionen
127679.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

Try to solve the puzzle first and find out what is hiding behind the optical illusions to get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

127680.name: 43AD
rpghonor: 2012 UK Games Expo Best Role-playing Game Nominee
127680.description:
Subtitle: -Invasion and Insurrection- Roleplaying in Roman Britain

Publisher blurb:

43AD is a gritty military-style game with a slice of dark horror running through it. Life is grim and the world of the native Britons is painted in dark and horrific colours. Britain is a place of fear and death, terrors and torments, and the Iron-Age tribes live with these horrors. Celtic priests, the druids, contain them in lakes and pits and forests. When the legions step onto British soil, they step onto a land of ancient horrors of which they (as yet) know nothing. Life, honour and warfare amongst the tribes is explained for players and GMs alike.

Characters are Roman soldiers, fighting for the emperor in a hostile land against the battle-hardened warriors of the tribes. This is the visible enemy, but beyond, should the Game Master wish to go there, lay the dark secrets of Britain, the night terrors, the death-bringing spirits of the wild, the night crawlers, the face eaters, the skinchangers and the rest of the monsters and wild things that infest Britain.

Using fast and gory rules from the tried and test web-game Zenobia, 43AD powers along at a pace. All rolls are made on d6, with the exception of a d100 being used in character creation.

Includes:


9 maps of Roman Britain
Examples of both play and character creation
31 adventure seeds
Pregenerated squad of Roman soldiers
Complete list of useful NPCs
GM guide to running Roman military games
Fully mapped starting location and base area
Spells
Monsters
Cultural information on Romans and Britons
Character write-ups that fit on a single index card
10 minute character creation

127681.name: Pocket Quiz: IQ-Training
127681.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. Pocket IQ quiz contains 50 training exercises and solutions to puzzles, Dice, rates, lateral thinking and After. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

Solve the task first and get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

127682.name: Pocket Quiz: Brain-Games
127682.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The ultimate knowledge-check! Test your skills on the subject of Brain Games! Confusing and challenging puzzles to think and thinking around the corner
Solve the task first and get the card.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

127683.name: Pocket Quiz: Gedächtnistraining
127683.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

Every kind of concentration tasks to make better than opponents and win the cards.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

127684.name: Walkers
127684.description:
Orsay is a quiet rural town 22 km from Paris, which dawns infested with grotesque creatures, undead, they multiply rapidly and roam the city looking for new victims ... The year is 1899, you are a survivor in this hell on earth, you should survive or become a WALKER!

Walkers is a board game for 2-6 players created by Julio Trois, which is about a zombie apocalypse at the turn of the twentieth century, where you must survive with a small group of people, using equipment found in a city taken by undead creatures.

Players can play with the heroes or the zombies, each turn move the board, collecting equipment, fighting zombies, seeking to perform the missions of the game. Walkers is a fast, easy, strategic, collaborative, where players view the action from the start!

127685.name: Suffragetto
boardgameversion: Women's Social and Political Union first edition 1909
127685.description:
The idea of the game is that of a contest between two opposing factions, the Suffragettes and the police. The object of the game is to be first to get six
pieces into the opposing home's base. The home camp for the Police is shown
as the House of Commons. The base for the suffragettes is Albert Hall.

Each side has 16 pieces. The pieces for the suffragettes are 16 small pieces for member suffragettes and 5 large pieces for Suffragette party leaders. The 21 police are 16 policemen and 5 inspectors.

This game was a two part set. The pieces were in a small box with a separate game board.

127687.name: Serpents' Teeth
127687.description:
From the back of the book:

Serpents' Teeth is a collection of supplementary material for Jaws of the Six Serpents, our roleplaying game of swords and sorcery using the PDQ system. It can be adapted easily for other RPGs.

Inside you’ll find adventure outlines, longer adventures with their own setting material, new setting options, and guidance on using Jaws rules for the sword and planet and pulp action genres.

127688.name: Fog of War
127688.description:
From the front cover:

The giants are planning war. They are searching for something hidden deep in their past. Something that will unite the races and tribes. Something that has been hidden in history but waiting to be found.

127689.name: Escape from Castle Island
127689.description:
Publisher's description:

Avast Matey! Here be an adventure for the Honor + Intrigue Swashbuckling RPG system!

Hundreds of islands dot the Spanish Main. Though Spain’s influence crawls across the islands like a spider, dozens of islands lay undiscovered. In one island’s case, this is exactly how it is to be arranged. La Isla Castillo, or Castle Island, is home to dozens of prisoners, supposedly executed or lost at sea. The prisoners are brought here to work a secret diamond mine in the name of a mysterious patron known only as "The Admiral"...

This adventure is about the heroes' daring escape from Castle Island, and the begining of a new career as pirates in the Caribbean in search of treasure. Along the way they'll meet an assortment of the worst scum and villainy with a few other heroic individuals mixed in.

This Product Includes:


The Escape from Castle Island adventure for Honor + Intrigue



2 New Dueling Styles: The Swartzpulver pistol style and the Dance of Blades knife style, as well as advice on how to emphasize the lethality of knives.



Six Sample PCs: For GMs or players in a hurry, these premade characters can be helpful. Included is a brief backstory for each, but with plenty of room for customization.

127690.name: Oasis
videogamehonor: 2004 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Winner
2004 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Winner
2006 D.I.C.E. Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
127690.description:
From the box:

Rescue your lands & defend your empire!

Oasis combines the simple game play with the rich historical enchantment. Features include:

A classic strategy and challenging puzzle game all in one!
Levels go by in minutes, but you play for hours.
10 tutorial modes available.
Uniquely generated levels.
Infinite game play with over 35 levels.
4 distinct difficulty levels.
2 expanding play modes.
Play Classic Oasis mode to tune your strategy click by click, then graduate to Pharaoh's Challenge to relive celebrated historical sagas such as Plagues of Egypt or the Trials of Nanakhut.
Vibrant graphics and sound.





User summary by zefquaavius:

Oasis is essentially a solitaire board game with a few real-time elements. Explore the Egyptian terrain of your domain, looking for supporters to stave off invaders, more followers to help explore, etc. The details you must manage and gambles you must make grow more complex as the game progresses, but each level is self-contained. One of the designers, Andrew Leker, said of the game, "A level consists of 85 carrots and one big stick. The player takes 85 turns discovering and rebuilding his or her empire, where every turn creates some kind of goodness."

127691.name: Panic! card game
127691.description: From the box. A wild and frantic speed game that everyone plays at once. The game is described and a great party and family fun game based on the fast style of play. It is a race to get rid of all cards by playing onto a center stack. Teams or individuals play provides hours of exciting family & party fun. 3 decks of 168 cards numbered 1-12 in 3 colors. Game can be played in teams or individually. All 3 decks are shuffled individually then passed, 5 cards dealt up and 12 cards dealt down. Then panic begins. As each card face up is played, it is replaced by one of the 12 down card. This continues until all 17 cards are played and the first player out of cards yells panic. But remember it takes a #1 card to start a stack. Then the cards are separated by team color and scored as per the instructions. The first team to reach 200 is the winner.

127692.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The fifth campaign expansion for Dust Tactics, Operation "Hades" introduces new rules for subterranean warfare, superhuman soldiers, new skills, and richly detailed information about the city and battleground of Zverograd. It also brings you thirty-one tiles, a Zverograd city poster, a map of the Zverograd metro, six new scenarios, and over two dozen objectives to serve as the basis of your own scenarios. Finally, Operation "Hades" marks the arrival of Winter Child, the game's first superhuman soldier.

Operation "Hades" introduces new rules for underground fighting, as well as rules more specifically designated for scenarios fought in Zverograd’s sewers and metro.

During underground combat, troops must cope with dim lighting and confined quarters. There is very little light beneath the city of Zverograd. Units can hear enemies coming, but they are hard to make out in the darkness. As a result, it's not uncommon for soldiers in such tense conditions to fire blindly into the shadows ahead of them when they hear enemies approaching. The darkness of the underground grants a unit increasing levels of cover the farther it is from an attacking unit, and units cannot target foes with four or more spaces between them.
127692.name: Dust Tactics: Operation "Hades"

127693.name: Dungeon Twister
127693.description:
User Summary:

Dungeon Twister has finally found it's way onto gaming consoles. The famous boardgame by Christophe Boelinger was made into a digital version by Hydravision and is first released for the PlayStation 3, while also being planed to be available on other gaming consoles like X-Box 360, or on the Steam network for PCs.

The goal of the game is to maneuver a group of up to 8 characters through a set of rotatable maze-like rooms and reach the other side of the maze, before your enemy does the same. Each character has a special ability that helps you pass solid walls or jump deadly spiked pits. Combat is also possible and a viable strategy to block your enemy from leaving the dungeon. Combat is resolved with combat-cards, with values ranging from +0 to +6. The trick is, your higher combat-cards are only usable once, so you have to make decisions on when to use a card and when to hold back.

127695.name: Plumage
127695.description:
From the rules
"A domino type game, consisting of 49 card depicting seven species of birds, in which the Males (M) and Females (F) differ in their plumage. The game is played by identifying and matching the correct males and females. There is also one card for each species depicting the Young (Y)."

The game is played in a traditional domino manner except you are matching male and female pairs, and you are able to add a young below a 'paired' male and female (in which case you are able to take an extra turn). The winner is the first player to get rid of all the cards in his hand, or if the pack becomes exhausted and no one can 'go' the player with the least cards wins.

The cards have realistic artwork depicting the birds in a style similar to a bird reference book.

There is also another game variant included in the rules, called 'Bridges' which is for two players, and involves players creating columns of matching pairs of the same species or families of the same species, and bridges between the two players columns. Points are awarded for creating 12 card columns, and for creating bridges between columns. Games continue until one player has scored 30 points.

127696.name: Segelfliegen
127696.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 50)
learn more about flying a glider
- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -

meeples are moved according the die roll;
ending on a marked space follow instructions..

remarks:
published between 1939 - 45 (see logo)

127697.name: Rumble
127697.description:
Rumble is a fast-paced word game where you can challenge your friends or allow an opponent to be chosen randomly. Who can find the most words in two minutes?

Source: The Game Website.

127698.name: Riddle of the Runes: The Worlds of TSR
127698.description:
From the back of the box:

More than a Screen Saver, an Interactive Puzzle!

Worlds of TSR introduces you to the incredible realms created by the masters of fantasy. These stunning art panels include a built-in puzzle in the form of a treasure hunt. It seems a crafty fiend made off with the treasure of a god and left clues to its whereabouts scattered across the Advanced Dungeons & Dragons worlds. Test your intellect as you scan for hints to the final resting place of the richest treasure of the known realms.

Features:
- Built-in puzzle makes this more than a screen saver, but an interactive adventure!
- Three modes to choose from: The Seer - Randomly displays the fantasy artwork, The Adventurer - Plan your own quest, and The Riddlemaster - Gather clues to the treasure hunt!
- Over 200 masterpieces from the archives of TSR digitally recreated to display the wonders of the fantasy realms!
- Original characters and worlds taken from the classic AD&D campaigns included: Forgotten Realms, Dark Sun, Ravenloft, and Planescape.
- Eight haunting musical scores that match the style of each campaign setting.

127699.name: Pointzy
127699.description:
Roll 5 dices and try to achieve the highest score. The rolls are entered in a 5x5 sheet, and the score is the points on the dice. Later in the game the rolls have to match the numbers already in the protcol. After 10 turns (5 horisontal lines and 5 vertical lines)
the highest score wins

127701.name: Chess-kers
127701.description:
A Checkers variant played with red/white reversible pieces, five to each player, on a 6 x 7 grid of red, white, and blue squares. The rules on the back of the box include three variants of the game.

Each player starts on either narrow side of the board; the objective is to capture all the opponent's pieces to win. Movement of the pieces is dictated by the color of the square which each piece is on. Pieces are captured by landing on them, turning them over, and placing them on the capturing player's side of the board. The three variants have slightly different rules to increase difficulty of winning.

127702.name: Chek-O-Rama
127702.description:
Checkers with 4 players on a 14 x 14 grid, with the 9 squares of each corner cut out. 12 pieces to a player; game starts with pieces laid out in usual checkers fashion but on four sides of board. Rules for 2 player and partners variants are included.

The game's box boasts: "First NEW CHECKER GAME in over 3000 years"

127703.name: Happy Digits Creativity
127703.description:
Promotional board game as an award for "Happy Digits" premium customers of T-D1.

Communicative game with many notions about telecommunications and mobile communications and also on general topics. The terms are either paraphrased, pantomime presented or drawn. In the category of "Creativity" creative brainstorms are exchanged.

6 game figures, 4 x 33 cards, one die, 1 set of instructions

The first print run was limited to 5,000 copies.

127704.name: Biene Maja Spiel
127704.description:
Promotional board game for children of the Nuremberg insurance policyholders. Illustrations and game pieces are in the design of "Biene Maja".

The game features two games in one:   A classic "Ludo", which is named "Biene Majas Wiesenrennen" ("Bee Maja meadow race") here, and a running game about the company's junior breakdown cover, where the children have to safeguard themselves against hazards   and at the end of the game to have as much money as possible.

Includes: double-sided game plan at 360 x 360mm,   16 pieces (4 pieces per style), 1 dice, 33 green event cards, 33 red hazard maps, 85 insurance policies, 150 play money bills

The print run was limited to 5,000 copies.

127705.name: Backtivity
127705.description:
Two to six players must illustrate a lot of baking-specific terms through pantomime, drawing or describing them. The other players have to guess the words. It is not quite as easy to define Donauwelle, mime yeast, or draw rye bread, so this can become quite adventurous and funny.

Game Contents: 1 game board, which illustrates the genesis of a bread from the wheat fields to the bakery, 99 action cards, 6 pawns, 1 game instructions

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
127706.name: Ironwood Gorge
127706.description:
author blurb

Orcs have returned to the once quiet border province of Blackmarch. The Bleak Tower and its meager garrison are all that stand against the tide. Their only hope lies in a ratag band of adventurers willing to venture into the perilous maw of Ironwood Gorge...

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
127707.name: Kingmaker
127707.description:
author blurb

Tragedy has fallen on the Kingdom of Ambarge-the King is dead; long live the King! But the kingdom's woes have only just begun, for the crown prince, the King's sole heir, is nowhere to be found. The fate of their kingdom rests on the deeds of a handful of wayward pilgrims that walk a solitary road in a remote land.

127708.name: Pocket Quiz: Englisch Grammatik
127708.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "English grammatic".

127709.description:
This is a tower-building game using plastic building blocks in eight colors.

The blocks are retrieved from a box with 6 x 6 compartments. Only a few compartments are available at any time decided by dice rolling. As a part of game setup the building blocks are put in the box and the box is shaken upside down and then right side up to randomly divide the blocks in the compartments.

From a deck of "building orders" a row of four available orders are drawn and two rows above it forms a future market.

Each player gets a set of six action cards numbered 1,2,2,3,3,4, four special cards and a base plate in his color to build the tower on.

The game is played in six rounds. Each round starts with that each player secretly chooses one of his six action cards. Everyone reveals which card they chose and each player gets as many actions as the number on the card. The cards are discarded after each round and cannot be used again.

The players take turns performing one action at a time and does one of the following:

- Take blocks from one allowed department.
- Choose a building order card and build (but you have to have the blocks first). When a card is chosen the cards above are moved down and the lower is made available. Add a card from the deck to the empty space on the top row.
- Discard all available build order cards, move down the cards from the upper rows and refill the top row.
- Reroll the dice that decides which compartments are avaialble.
- Pass (do nothing).

At the end of each round the dice are rerolled to descide which compartments are available next round. Discard all available build order cards, move down the cards from the upper rows and refill the top row.

Some of the build orders are special and are not built until the end of the game where they allow you to add blocks to your tower depending on how your current tower looks like (color patterns).

Some build orders uses blocks from your opponents supply, or even tower. Some changes the order of blocks in the tower or adds blocks in the middle of a tower. Some cards are used to manipulate actions and order of actions.

Highest tower wins!
127709.name: The Ogels: Building a Tower

127710.name: Pocket Quiz: Business Englisch
127710.description: This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

127711.name: Pocket Quiz: Italienisch Aktiv
127711.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

By answering the questions themselves, the students memorize the Italian language.

127712.name: Pocket Quiz: Spanisch Aktiv
127712.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

By answering the questions themselves, the students memorize the Spanish language.

127713.name: Pocket Quiz: Deutsch für Ausländer Wortschatz
127713.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "German for foreigner - vocabulary".

127715.name: Tannhäuser: Frankenstahl
127715.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The black alchemy of Baron Oberst Reimard Von Karloff, along with the magic of the hermetics that serve him, has brought a writhing mass of flesh and pistons to life! Enemies of the Reich cannot deny the danger this poses, both to the freedom of the world and to the very laws of nature themselves.

The Tannhäuser: Frankenstahl expansion includes one painted figure and an accompanying character sheet, a twelve-page rulebook with an all-new scenario, and all the tokens and equipment cards necessary to bring this deadly abomination to your battles.

127716.name: Dinotopia: The Sunstone Odyssey
127716.description:
Dinotopia: The Sunstone Odyssey is a 2003 action-adventure video game released by Vicious Cycle Software. The game is based on the Dinotopia book series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dinotopia: The Sunstone Odyssey", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127717.name: Shards of the Exalted Dream
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
127717.description:
From the PDF


The world of Exalted has been reflected in the minds and stories of players across the world for over a decade. Now the mirror shatters, and White Wolf presents a collection of unique new visions of Exalted, shards of imagination to take your games through alternate realities, twisted histories, new genres, and even to the stars.

In addition to re-imaginings of the classic setting, this book also contains a plethora of new rules to support those visions, or for enterprising Storytellers to use to create their own new takes on Exalted. What worlds will you forge from your dreams?

This book includes:

Four fully-realized alternate settings, including modern, space opera, alternate history, and martial arts takes on Exalted.
Over 130 new Charms, including material for all Exalt types and full support for Drive and Firearms-based magic.
New artifacts, vehicles, rules hacks, subsystems, and a complete new system for martial arts-based games, featuring 150 unique Techniques.

127718.name: Naruto: Rise of a Ninja
videogamehonor: 2007 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
127718.description:
Naruto: Rise of a Ninja is an Xbox 360-exclusive video game developed by Ubisoft Montreal, making it the first Naruto game to be developed by a non-Japanese company. The game is specifically based on the English dubbed version of the anime. Ubisoft has also released a free 60-mb download which includes a Japanese voice option, the ability to change the in-game voices to Japanese, while still keeping the English subtitles. A sequel titled Naruto: The Broken Bond was released on November 18, 2008.

Source: Wikipedia, "Naruto: Rise of a Ninja", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127720.name: Naruto: The Broken Bond
videogamehonor: 2009 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
127720.description:
Naruto: The Broken Bond is an adventure game developed by Ubisoft Montreal and published by Ubisoft for the Xbox 360. It was released on November 18, 2008 in North America.
The Broken Bond picks up where Naruto: Rise of a Ninja left off, taking place between episodes 81-135 of the anime. It contains the Return of Itachi, Search for Tsunade, and the Sasuke Retrieval story arcs. There are 30 playable characters, a new tag-team system and original voice acting and music from the original Naruto anime.

Source: Wikipedia, "Naruto: The Broken Bond", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127721.description:
The night before June 6th, 1944, more than ten thousand Allied paratroopers were dropped into enemy territory to prepare the Normandy landings – but the troop-carrying planes were blasted by German anti-aircraft fire, scattering their airborne troops everywhere but where they were supposed to be.

You are one of these paratroopers. And as luck turns out, the winds have blown you directly where you are needed the most! As you were descending, you discovered a terrible sight: the Germans have installed two 24.0 cm Guns in a hidden bunker. Those cannons are set to fire at the beaches of Normandy. You alone can stop them from killing the Allied troops! All you need is some explosives...

In Airborne In Your Pocket, players explore their surroundings by placing Location tiles and resolving Event cards every turn. They must find the Ammo Dump to obtain some explosives and enter the bunker to sabotage its guns. Of course, there are German soldiers everywhere, so players will have to hide or fight their way through.

AIYP can be as simple (Basic Game) or as involved (Scenarios & Campaigns) as the player wishes. The Advanced Game and Scenarios allow you to play as American, British, Canadian and French soldiers. The game comes in four different sets, and each set has enough components for one player. To add more players, add more sets (up to four can play).

Reimplements:


Airborne In Your Pocket: Free Trial Version
127721.name: Airborne In Your Pocket

127722.name: The Outer Reach
127722.description:
From the publisher:

For as long as mankind has sailed the void of the Jericho Reach, it has been a place of danger and mystery. Evil slumbers in the forgotten places between the stars, and only the Deathwatch can stand before it.

The Outer Reach is an exciting supplement for Deathwatch! Revealing the secret dangers that lurk in the darkness between the stars, The Outer Reach gives players and GMs never-before-seen access to the enigmatic Dead Cabal, a mysterious circle of warrior-scholars who have devoted their lives to fathoming the unfathomable. What’s more, this arcane tome presents the lost history of the arrogant and merciless Necrons of the Suhbekhar dynasty, and it offers the latest intelligence regarding their horrifically imminent return. All this, along with details on various Suhbekhar warriors, in-depth looks at the worlds beyond the reach of the Achilus Crusade, and scores of useful plot hooks, makes The Outer Reach an invaluable addition to any Deathwatch library.

127723.name: Wiesbadener Rundreise
127723.description:
Foreword:
The present, in his new game has the purpose of art, the beautiful spa town of Weisbaden world to your friends and admirers, many or even those who do not yet know, in a curious way to show off fancy.

Where this game can take up to 7 people. Marked with an international name-cards are placed face down and travel company of each of the players pulled a. one who is traveling cashier, who draws the card rothschild. The participants play the cards soon hang on a ribbon around the neck and Rothschild founded the common fund travel by collecting stamps per head 5 as insert. In exchange, his Everyman figure (see figure on the cover), it is henceforth to occupy the fields. Rotshchild rolls themselves do not cooperate, he has exercised his duties as a cashier for now. Should it be during the game just as gangs fund, he has the right to demand tax payments.
 
The travel company gathered at the Hotel Victoria, from where begins the tour of Wiesbaden. The whole route is divided into fields and puts each trim figure so many more fields than the owner throws the same eyes. The order in which the dice is going on is determined by the number of visit cards, ie who has the lowest number rolls first.

who is now the first hotel in Victoria, the starting point of the round trip again arrived, receives marks 5 marks the Second 3. The remaining cash asset-but Rothschild reaps for his professional services rendered as a travel clerk

127724.name: DungeonRaid
127724.description:
DungeonRaid is a new fantasy deck-building game designed to capture the charm and atmosphere of the console RPGs of days long gone.

The game begins with a small card draft to determine starting equipment. Then, in a classic Deck-building fashion, players purchase weapons, armor, and spells in turn and use them to fight monsters and bosses; all of which come into the supply randomly. Used equipment cycles back through the deck as it needs to be repaired and the player's goal is to collect the most wealth from the Dungeon while at the same time trying not to be the first to get killed.

"Staged" levels of difficulty increase the challenge at regular intervals and also introduce improved Treasure to the supply. This aspect also makes the game highly expandable, and gives it immense replay value.

(Tentatively) Recommended for 2-5 players, but solitaire play will be an option.

[This game is still in development, and development is currently on hold. Release date is yet unknown.]

127725.name: SSN-589 USS Scorpion Down
127725.description:
From 1km1kt.net:

It is late in May 1968, in the middle of the Cold War and the Vietnam conflict. Far out in the Atlantic, Nuclear Attack Sub Scorpion breaks all radio contact. Then, for reasons unknown, the vessel sinks to critical depth. Its hull cracks. 99 men and women are lost. What happened?

127726.name: Sudoku (BB)
127726.description:
The challenge comes from having to fill a 9x9 grid so that every row, column and 3x3 box within the grid contains the digits 1-9. Sudoku is a highly addictive blend of logic and lateral thinking.

Sound easy? You’ll change your tune after your first round of Sudoku!

The rules of Sudoku are simple. The numbers have no numerical or arithmetic value; they represent symbols that cannot be repeated. Enter digits from 1 to 9 into the blank spaces of the board. Every row, column and 3x3 subsection of the grid must contain one and only one of each digit.

Each Sudoku puzzle has a unique solution that can be reached logically.

There are four levels of difficulty, based on how many numbers are provided when you start the puzzle.

EASY: 34-36
MEDIUM: 30-32
HARD: 27-29
GENIUS: 24-26

You can play 50 puzzles per level. Select Statistics to see how many per level you have completed and your best and average time.

Source: The Developer Website.

127727.description:
These Promo Cards will be available with each copy of the game offered through Preview Nights (at participating stores) as well as at select conventions.

The cards add more scoring opportunities to Island Fortress. Included in the set are 11 Secret Scoring Cards, 8 Community Scoring Cards, and 1 Instructions Card.
127727.name: Island Fortress Promo Cards

rpg: How I Learned To Stop Worrying And Love The Bomb Shelter
127728.name: How I Learned To Stop Worrying And Love The Bomb Shelter
127728.description:
From 1km1kt.net:

The game can be played using different scenarios, which define the nature of the setting and the types of characters. Two scenarios are included in this version of the game: “Get Down In The Bomb Shelter, Mr(s) President” (where players attempt to protect or kill a political figure such as a King, Queen or President in a high-security official nuclear fallout bunker) and “Porterhouse Code Blue” (where players attempt to protect or kill the master of an Oxbridge college in a wine cellar, basement lecture hall or Anderson shelter).

The game is designed to be played in a single sitting face-to-face, but it could be played in other formats (such as play-by-post or LARP) with little or no modification.

127729.name: Texas Hold'em King 2
127729.description:
THK2 was Magmic’s first foray into multiplayer poker, offering tournaments and head to head play right from the user’s device. Using servers hosted by Magmic, players were able to play games of Poker with up to 5 other people live, at the same time. Like the previous version it was available on a variety of devices and is still being played due to it being pre-loaded on a variety of BlackBerry handsets.

Magmic also hosted a tournament in late March 2007 which the winner received an all-expenses paid trip to Orlando in May of the same year.

Features

Ring game, Tournament and World Series modes
Standalone and Multiplayer modes
Online Buddy Lists and Friend Finder
4 Color Deck for suit visibility
Customize with dozens of avatars and 7 different designed decks
In game chat and chat macros
Tournaments for real prizes.

Source: Wikipedia, "Texas Hold'em King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127730.name: Texas Hold'em King 3
127730.description:
Building on the success of THK2, Magmic released Texas Hold’em King 3 in April of 2008. With improved graphics and multiplayer features, the game also offered a unique “turbo mode” for Single Player gameplay. At the peak of its success, THK3 had a community of over 100,000 players and added to the total franchise downloads of over 5 million. It was ported for Android in late 2010.

Source: Wikipedia, "Texas Hold'em King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.


The third edition of the best Texas Hold’em mobile franchise, with fast and brilliant game play and networked multi-player tournaments. Join an online poker community of over 100,000.

Texas Hold’em King 3 is the latest installment in Magmic Games's popular mobile poker franchise. This latest edition improves upon the franchise’s already fast, brilliant game play and adds improved multi-player features. Single Player Mode features a unique “Turbo Mode” that fast-forwards you to the end of a hand once you’ve folded. In Multi-Player mode you can play online against other mobile players. Through the extensive mobile poker community, you can submit various high scores for bragging rights, view other players’ profiles, manage your buddy lists and message opponents in-game. In Contest Mode, you also have a chance compete against others to win prizes through special Magmic promotions.

For those new to poker, “No Limit Texas Hold’em” is a game of skill, cunning and deception. It is by far the most popular poker game in casinos and at homes throughout North America and Europe. This is the game played during the “World Series of Poker” and other major tournaments. Texas Hold’em King 3 is the third edition of Magmic’s “Texas Hold’em King” series, one of the top mobile poker franchises with over 5 million product downloads and a multi-player community of over 100,000.

Source: The Developer Website.

127731.name: Texas Hold'em King
127731.description:
Released in June 2004, Texas Hold’em King was the first instalment in the THK franchise. It was ported to multiple devices, including BlackBerry and J2ME devices and offered players a poker experience unlike most others available. Primarily a single player game it served as the foundation for the next version, Texas Hold’em King 2.

Source: Wikipedia, "Texas Hold'em King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127732.name: BrickBreaker
127732.description:
The object of BrickBreaker is to destroy bricks using a paddle and a ball. During the game, capsules fall from the bricks that you destroy. The capsules provide you with different mechanisms for destroying bricks or controlling the ball or paddle.

If the ball hits the paddle, a brick or the top of the game board 50 times on any level, the bricks descend one space each time that you hit the ball with the paddle.

Source: The Publisher Website.

127733.name: Seeded Space
127733.description:
From 1km1kt.net:

Inside these 111 pages you will find 7 character classes, 9 races (including humans, animal hybrids, and artificial life), over 80 psychic powers, hundreds of special tech items, many alien and genetically engineered creatures (some familiar from fantasy role-playing and others all new), plenty of random tables (including a recipient of Honourable Mention in Fight One’s Contest for Random Tables), and a campaign setting to help you explore frontier colonies, aging space stations, and endless worlds of adventure.

There is also a short adventure to help you get started, Epsilon Outpost, which was an entry in the 2010 One Page Dungeon Contest and can be reused any number of times.

127735.name: The Web
127735.description: The board is a web with holes in the intersections. The pieces are pegs that have numbers printed on them. Each peg can move the number of spaces printed on it. Some pieces can land on other pieces and remove them from the game. Each player moves their pieces along the web aiming to get their pieces to the opposing player's start space. the piece is then put into the player's safe zone. The winner of the game is the player that gets the most pieces into the safe zone.

127736.name: The Emerald Enchanter
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
127736.description: Villagers have been disappearing—and some of them are your friends! A number of clues, various old superstitions, and a handful of vague omens point to the brooding citadel of the emerald enchanter. This silent monolith has sat undisturbed atop a windy ridge for centuries. Legends say that a green-skinned sorcerer dwells there, where he conducts strange experiments and builds enigmatic machinery. His emerald constructs patrol the grounds of his citadel, and he is seen only rarely when he ventures out on nefarious errands that end in horrid screams and strange lights coming from his citadel. Now you believe he is holding your friends captive. To rescue them—and potentially acquire some loot along the way—you set off to invade his inner sanctum. -- from the Player Beginning

127737.name: Wat vindt Nederland?
127737.description:
The boardgame based on the popular Dutch television show "Wat vindt Nederland?" in which two teams compete against each other, trying to find out what the general Dutch opinion is. Teams will get a statement - mostly based on recent events - and have to try and guess what the opinion of the Dutch public is on the statement. Whichever team is closer, wins the round.

Just like the RTL4 show this game is about opinions and how well you think you know them. The game uses a large variety of recent issues on which popular opinion has been polled. Your task is to find out which is the general consensus among the Dutch audience and score points by doing so.

127738.name: Pocket Quiz Teekesselchen
127738.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 100 word puzzles. The backside of each card contains meanigs of the words and additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

In this game there are words to solve what have multiple meanings.

127739.name: Pocket Quiz: Teekesselchen für Fortgeschrittene
127739.description:
