This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 100 word puzzles. The backside of each card contains meanigs of the words and additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

In this game there are words to solve what have multiple meanings.

127740.name: Pocket Quiz: Gehirnakrobatik
127740.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with ultimate knowledge-check! Test your skills when it comes to mental gymnastics. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

"Brain acrobatic" in English

127741.name: Pocket Quiz: Bilderrätsel
127741.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with creative thinking puzzles. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

"Picture-puzzle" in English

127742.name: Pocket Quiz: Rebus-Rätsel
127742.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with creative thinking puzzles. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

127743.name: Pocket Quiz: Geh-Hirn-Training
127743.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with confusing and challenging puzzles to think and thinking around the corner. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

"Brain-training" in English

127744.name: Pocket Quiz: Querdenken
127744.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with lateral thinking puzzles. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

127745.name: Attack of the Tyrantclaw
127745.description:
From the back of the book:
Attack of the Tyrantclaw is a Dungeons and Dragons Roleplaying game challenge designed for the March, April and May 2012 installment of the D&D Lair Assault official play program. It includes one full-color battlemap, one sheet of tokens, a laminated play aid, and information on the D&D Lair Assault program.

127746.name: Talon of Umberlee
127746.description:
From the back of the book:

Talon of Umberlee is a Dungeons and Dragons Roleplaying game challenge designed for the 2011 winter installment of the D&D Lair Assault official play program. It includes one full-color battlemap, one sheet of tokens, a laminated play aid, and information on the D&D Lair Assault program.

127747.name: Spiderkiller
127747.description:
From the first page:

Somewhere in the Lost Level of Undermountain, a fallen drow matron schemes to open a way to the Demonweb. Should she succeed, can anything stop Lolth's faithful?

127748.description:
In Alliances, you will play a superpower nation seeking world domination along with its ally. The game is mainly based on trick-taking mechanisms, with each trick representing a local struggle to control a country in the world. The world is composed of a vast number of countries, each one represented by a tile on the table. Each country also has its own defensive attributes: a certain military strength, economic strength and political strength which need to be overcome. In order to win, your alliance has to dominate the world by gaining control over the most countries.

Alliances includes three different games in one box:


For 2 players, a confrontational trick taking game.
For 3 players, a game in which each player in turn plays a superpower empire while the other two players fight him off as rebels.
For 4 players, a game in which you and your ally will team up to fight your rival alliance to control the world!
127748.name: Alliances
boardgamepodcastepisode: GenCon 2013 - Golden Egg Games

127749.name: Advanced Encounters: Terrain Toolbox (Pathfinder)
rpghonor: 2012 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee
127749.description:
From the publisher's website:

Terrain Toolbox is the first in a planned series of books that offer advice and tools for DMs to create more memorable encounters. Terrain Toolbox is designed to increase creative use of terrain in your game, making battles more dynamic.

The book begins with general advice for designing terrain effect and powers. It discusses why we use terrain, different things terrain can do, and how the terrain might change throughout an encounter.

Terrain Toolbox also contains forty-eight sample terrains, including blood mage’s circle, solid clouds, and lightning pillars. Each sample terrain includes advice on how to use the terrains, and most include mechanical and cosmetic variations.

127751.name: Pocket Quiz: Logisches Denken
127751.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with logical exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions.

Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

127752.name: Pocket Quiz: Mehr Gehirnjogging
127752.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions.

Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

Test your skills on the subject of more brain training! Confusing and challenging puzzles to think and thinking around the corner.

127753.name: Pocket Quiz: Gehirnjogging
127753.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions.

Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

127754.name: Grogs
127754.description:
Publisher Description:

They are the majority in almost every covenant, and without them things would come to an immediate halt. They spend their lives serving magi, and may lay those lives down to defend them. They are the cooks, servants, warriors, craftsmen, and hunters who keep the Order of Hermes running smoothly.

They are the magi's trusted grogs.

Grogs have much to offer any saga, from heroic death to comic relief, or even both at the same time. However, creating and maintaining dozens of characters can be a strain on the creativity and patience of even the finest troupes, and so grogs may be overlooked in favor of magi and companions. This book aims to right the balance. It contains dozens of fully developed grog concepts, complete with typical Abilities, and guidelines to simplify creating and maintaining grogs. It also includes suggestions on the roles grogs can play in covenants, and in sagas.

After all, even spear-carriers can leave memories that live forever.

127755.name: Pixel Patch: The Real Life RPG
127755.description:
Ever want your playing cards to be used for something more than a poker hand? Ever want to turn those hearts into healing items and those clubs into cash? We’ll, now you can.

Pixel Patch: The Real Life RPG is a 2-6 player card game that turn a standard deck of 52 cards into a a fun 8-bit RPG-influenced battle system. Players will try to work their way past their opponent’s defense through the cards they draft and grow more powerful through the games they play.

Every round, you will choose cards to decide whether to attack, defend, heal or gain influence for special abilities. You and your opponent will then decide whether to perform your action in an aggressive or defensive fashion and then draw a varying number of cards to determine your success.

This entire game can be played with just a deck of cards and a pad of paper if necessary, but player aids and guide books are also provided in the downloadable PDF.

The game ends when a player’s health reaches 0. At this point, experience points are handed out, which allow you to level up, boosting your original stats from your entrance exam and making your card drafts more powerful. All these stats are recorded on the printable booklets that come with the game.

This game is a great head to head challenge as you work to figure out what your opponent will do next and of course is immensely repayable as you work to unlock and master 11 unique classes.

Players can also boost their stats by purchasing RPG Patches from our website (listed in the links section); each one of these patches gives a different permanent stat boost to your character, without breaking the game.

127756.name: Lady Bug Fly-A-Way
127756.description: Players spin the dial and pump the flower once for each ladybug that appears in the spinner wheel until the balloon ladybug flies away.The balloon gets larger with each pump and if it flies away on your turn you win.

127757.name: Gaucho - An Interactive Geek Western
videogamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
127757.description:
Gaucho is a traditional interactive-fiction text adventure written for the 3rd Anniversary of RPG Geek and run site-wide in August, 2012.



RPGG Tavern Treads
Unofficial Gaucho anticipation thread.
Did I miss Gaucho?
The Saloon - Welcome Gauchos!
Favourite Gaucho-ism

127758.name: New Horizon Starter Guide 2.0
127758.description:
From publisher blurb:

The free Starter Guide provides detailed step-by-step information for player and game master (GMs) on how to create characters and RPGs for the New Horizon setting. Page 11-12 of the guide provides information about how to start your own game and other things you might need when playing.

127759.description:
Which TV series has more consequences: Dallas, the Black Forest clinic or Star Trek? And whose rates were better?

The categories are so specific that even players who are very much interested in the given topic (like Cult TVseries in this case), probably will not know the correct answers. Instead, every player has to do the best guess.
127759.name: Top 3: Kultserien

127760.name: MechaWar
127760.description:
MechaWar is the first title from the One Pound Wargames imprint of Precinct Omega Publishing. The game gives complete rules for building your forces of mighty mech walkers and pitting them in intense tactical combat against your opponent.


Use simple resource allocation to build and customize your force of mechs in minutes.
Play on any flat surface with a few pieces of terrain and any collection of mecha miniatures.
Skirmish-style action with alternating activation, each mech operating independently.
Intuitive combat uses dice to generate both range and accuracy for shooting as well as to resist and repair damage.
Manage your actions to pursue your objective or react dynamically to your opponent's manoeuvres.
Works for scales from 6mm to 15mm.
Includes advanced rules to customize your mechs as engineer, minelayer, commander or assault mechs.
Includes three starting scenarios.


This game eventually evolved into "Horizon Wars" published by Osprey
https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/193700/horizon-wars-scie...

127761.name: Dam
127761.description:
From the Introduction:

For the longest time the villages in the valleys below have been threatened by the regular spring flood when a hard winters worth of snow starts to thaw. Thus a number of small valley like this one have been dammed up, to accumulate most of the melt water and release it at a more sedate pace after spring. The dam itself has been built from heavy stone blocks and it is crowned by a simple tarred road. Tunnels through the rock at both ends connect it to civilization and other small dams like it.

127762.name: Mutantes en la Sombra
127762.description:
from the back of the book

Mutantes en la sombra es un juego de rol ambientado en la Europa de los 90. Los personajes, dotados de poderes extraordinarios, deberán luchar por su supervivencia en una selva de organizaciones dedicadas a la captura de mutantes.

A lo largo de 146 páginas, podrás encontrar toda la información que necesitas para ambientar tus partidas, la historia del fenómeno mutante, 28 profesiones, 17 poderes mutantes, 65 armas (incluídos 3 modelos de CETME), 89 vehículos y el módulo ELDORADO, preparado para que empiecea a jugar YA.

In english:

Mutantes en la sombra (Mutants in the shadow) is an RPG set in the Europe 90th years. The characters, endowed with extraordinary powers, must fight for survival in a jungle of organizations dedicated to capture mutants.

rpgitemversion: Guía Heracles de supervivencia en ambientes hostiles
127763.name: Guía Heracles de Supervivencia en Ambientes Hostiles
127763.description:
publisher blurb

La Guía Heracles de supervivencia en ambientes hostiles, es un suplemento para el juego de rol Mutantes en la sombra con algunas ayudas de juego. Tambien se incluye la pantalla de juego para el director de juego.

In english:
The Guía Heracles de supervivencia en ambientes hostiles (Guide Heracles survival in hostile environments) is a supplement rules for the roleplaying game "Mutants en la sombra" . Also included on the game screen.

127764.name: New Horizon Player's Guide, 2nd Edition
127764.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to a world that is not our own. Mankind’s new home among the stars is more than they ever imagined when they left Earth. The settlers are surrounded by bizarre alien creatures that are often as deadly as they are amazing. Their lives are filled with the wonders of technology, but are held together by the strength of their resolve. Mankind walks this new world hand in hand with wafans, their sister race of sentient living machines, designed during the darker days of humanity’s past. This is the world we live in, this is New Horizon. New Horizon is a roleplaying game that incorporates elements of science fiction, fantasy, utopian and dystopian fiction, and speculative fiction. New Horizon is a setting where advanced technologies and futuristic innovations are interweaved with the primeval roughness of an untamed world. It is a place where technology and nature are often seen struggling against one another, each protecting itself from the spread of the other.

127765.name: New Horizon Campaign Setting Guide, 2nd Edition
127765.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to a world that is not our own. Mankind’s new home among the stars is more than they ever imagined when they left Earth. The settlers are surrounded by bizarre alien creatures that are often as deadly as they are amazing. Their lives are filled with the wonders of technology, but are held together by the strength of their resolve. Mankind walks this new world hand in hand with wafans, their sister race of sentient living machines, designed during the darker days of humanity’s past. This is the world we live in, this is New Horizon.

New Horizon is a roleplaying game that incorporates elements of science fiction, fantasy, utopian and dystopian fiction, and speculative fiction. New Horizon is a setting where advanced technologies and futuristic innovations are interweaved with the primeval roughness of an untamed world. It is a place where technology and nature are often seen struggling against one another, each protecting itself from the spread of the other.

127767.name: New Horizon 2nd Edition Primer
127767.description:
User summary:

A primer for both the campaign setting as well as system for the 2nd Edition of New Horizon.

127768.name: Herald of Oblivion
127768.description:
From the Black Library:

You are a veteran Space Marine of the Imperial Fists Chapter. Equipped with powerful Terminator armour and armed with the deadliest weapons that the Adeptus Astartes wield, you are a symbol of the Emperor's might. Trapped aboard the space hulk Herald of Oblivion and the only survivor of your squad, you must fight your way through the aliens and heretics that infest the star vessel and find a way to escape the horror and return to your Chapter.

127769.name: Savage Ghostbusters GM Guide
127769.description:
From Introduction:

Ghosts, demigods and other paranormal and pandimensional entities are real, and quite often hostile to ordinary mortal beings ... but fortunately these problems can be dealt with via a generous application of projected particles or positively-charged ectoplasm. Thus, with the dead getting restless and various long-forgotten quasi-deities rising up to vie for the right to bring on the Apocalypse, there’s plenty of business to be had for the Ghostbusters.

The following are some notes with ideas on how to run Ghostbusting missions using the Savage Worlds rules.

This is GM territory, so players should read no further!

127770.name: Savage Ghostbusters Player Guide
127770.description:
From Introduction:

Some say it’s the “end times,” that the world will end with the close of the millennium — or even before that. The dead are restless, ancient demigods strive to take over the world, and occasionally a giant marshmallow man or the Statue of Liberty strides through Manhattan. Even with the apocalypse nigh, plenty of folks want to get on with their ordinary lives, without inconvenient interruptions by the “living impaired.”

That’s where the heroes come in, as members of a local Ghostbusters franchise. After all, not every haunt happens in New York City.

Also, not every haunt involves full-torso apparitions or free-roaming vapors, let alone corporeal manifestations. Sometimes a Ghostbusting gig requires careful research and investigation, staking out a haunted site with cameras and various sensors to try to pinpoint the location of minor PKE spikes and ectoplasmic formation, before it’s time to switch on the proton packs and toss out the ghost traps. Therefore, a wide variety of skills is useful for a Ghostbusters team — not just good aim with a neutrona wand.

Our story unfolds sometime circa the late 1980s or very early 1990s, after the events as portrayed in the movies Ghostbusters and Ghostbusters II. The world has been saved from nigh- apocalyptic supernatural catastrophes twice by the original Ghostbusters gang, but paranormal activity is still on the rise. Best of all, customers are paying good money to have the Ghostbusters do something about it.

So, strap on your proton pack, make sure the light is green on your ghost trap, and check the batteries on your PKE meter and ecto-goggles. It’s time to bust some ghosts!

127771.name: Wortissimo: Der schnelle Wortsport
127771.description:
The aim of the game is to explore as many words as possible with given word.

The players draw a card on which a term is mentioned. For a limited time players should find as many words as possible with the letters included in that words.
Player also roll the die with special activities like "R" - the words must be words if reversed etc.

If the hourglass expired, the points (also called Wortissimo) distributed.
There are only German and Germanized terms.

The game types will vary in each period, depending on which letters or numbers rolled. After ten rounds, the points are added together and the one of the most Wortissimo is the winner.

127772.name: Wortissimo Level 2: Der noch schnellere Wortsport
127772.description:
Even faster word sports than Wortissimo. Are you ready for the next level? The hunt for hidden words continues!

The aim of the game is to explore as many words as possible with given word.

The players draw a card on which a term is mentioned. For a limited time players should find as many words as possible with the leroll the die with special activities like "R" - the words must be words if reversed etc.

If the hourglass expired, the points (also called Wortissimo) distributed.
There are only German and Germanized terms.

The game types will vary in each period, depending on which letters or numbers rolled. After ten rounds, the points are added together and the one of the most Wortissimo is the winner.

127773.name: Bomberman GB
127773.description:
Bomberman GB, known in Japan as Bomberman GB 2 (ボンバーマンGB二 Bonbāman Jī Bī Ni?), is a Game Boy game released in 1995 by Hudson Soft in Japan and in 1998 by Nintendo for North American and European territories. It is the sequel to Wario Blast: Featuring Bomberman!.

The game was part of a limited series of Game Boy games that were enhanced for play on the Super Nintendo through the Super Game Boy device. The enhanced game offered a special Bomberman frame around the TV screen, color graphics and custom explosion sounds, and a multiplayer mode which allowed for simultaneous gameplay between opponents up to four players through the use of a SNES Multitap. The game uses a password system to save progress instead of a battery back-up.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bomberman GB 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127774.name: Bomberman GB3
127774.description:
User Summary

Bomberman GB3 is the third game in the Bomberman GB series. The third installment was only released in Japan. In this outing Bomberman faces off against his nemesis Evil Bomberman.
The game takes places across six areas: Aqua, City, Ice, Lava, Sand, & Wood.

127775.name: A-Maze-Ing
127775.description:
From the box:

"A challenging combination of maze games to test your strategy skills. Race against time through increasingly difficult mazes filled with tempting cheese, towering obstacles, and devious cats!"

127776.name: Das Energie Quiz
127776.description:
62 exciting issues from politics, history, geography and science.

In player's turn his left neighbor reads aloud a question.
If he answer corretly he receives one point and must answer another question. Otherwise, the next player has a turn. The winner is whoever has accumulated the most points at the end.

127777.name: The Ghost Train
127777.description:
From Introduction:

News often travels slow in the Walk of Man once one gets outside the boundaries of the larger cities. Most news comes in the form of rumors brought in by train passengers and hunters returning home after expeditions on the plains. The latest rumors have taken a dark turn. Smaller settlements across the Walk have been found deserted. Most look as if the people just packed up and left. Nothing of value has been left behind, except for the larger permanent buildings. Three towns have disappeared so far with no one left dead or alive, and no one seems to have any clue as to what is going on. Smaller towns are getting scared, and the citizens are arming themselves more than usual against whatever strange events are taking place.

127778.name: Season of Gunshots, Part 1
127778.description:
From Introduction:

Times have always been tough in the Walk of Man. Being a hearty breed, those who live there generally like it that way. Why else would anyone live in one of the most rugged settled area of the planet? But as of late, times have been a little too tough for comfort for the average man of the Walk.

Political dissidents called the Rusty Stars have been staging a protest rally every time someone turns around, sabotaging legitimate efforts of the government, and all in favor of allowing every man to have a voice, and free elections. Not necessarily a bad idea, but they sure have an awful way of selling the idea. A lot of their chaos has slowed production, causing layoffs for people, so public sympathy for the cause isn’t what it could be, despite their turn for the worse having started with a shootout instigated by the entrenched government.

Many of the unemployed have been forced to find money through banditry, turning many young men and women away from their honest lives to banditry just to put food in their bellies, and the bellies of their families. This has torn many families apart of late, and almost everyone knows at least one person who’s had to turn away from an otherwise honest life to keep themselves above water.

To top it all off, animal attacks in the northern reaches are reaching record highs, with at least one small town completely wiped off the map by a rare Grim Stalker attack.

For the sake of bringing stability back to the region without calling in the military from Warhead, the Voice of the West, the no longer quite so esteemed leadership of Trapper Town and her dependents, has declared The Season of Gunshots open.

All able bodied men and women who need work and don’t have too much of a history of theft, rape or murder are invited to pick up a badge, and be deputized as members of the newly formed Allied Regional Militia. Once deputized, basic room and board will be provided, as well as work helping to clean up their troubled home.

But not all are here just for the money. Some see it as a stepping stone to law enforcement, and yet others see it as a patriotic duty. There are even a few people from abroad who see it as a civic duty to help their cousins in the Walk of Man. Regardless, you find yourself here today.

User note: It appears this is from the forthcoming New Horizon Game Master's Guide, 2nd Edition, but is also available as a separate download on the New Horizon Studios website.

rpgitemversion: First Edition full color Lulu perfec-tbound version
127779.name: New Horizon Monster Manual
127779.description:
From publisher blurb:

The New Horizon Monster Manual (book 4 of 4) is bestiary sourcebook for animals/monsters living on New Horizon. The book contains more than 70 different animals/monsters unique for this world. The book also contains information about the first humanoid creature (which is neither Human nor Wafan) from New Horizon, called “Faenorr”.

New Horizon is a science fiction world which holds the soul of a fantasy world’s loose and inventive play style and its sense of exploration and wonder. It's a brand new world, just waiting for you to explore it! If you enjoy role playing and science fiction then join New Horizon and be part of a new world beyond your imagination. New Horizon is a table top role playing game which uses an exciting new rule system called Volt where only two D20 dice are used.

Welcome to New Horizon!

127780.name: Moon Mine
127780.description:
From the box:

"You are captain of the U.S.S. Recovery and your mission is to capture treasures stolen from Earth. Battle against the mighty Zygonaut and his menacing creatures to save the world's most valuable treasures!"

127781.name: The Attack
127781.description:
From the box:

"You and your ship have been given a mission: Destroy the aliens before they destroy you!"

127782.name: Grandma's Game of Knots and Whys of Science
127782.description:
Question and answer game where each player is trying to answer the most questions correctly. Similar to McLoughlin's Gandmama series of games.

This game had 199 question cards, an answer book, and a set of instructions in the box.

127783.name: Grandmama's Old Testament Questions & Answers
127783.description:
In the 1860's the McLoughlin Brothers introduced a successful series of educational card games under the name "Grandmama's XXX Game." The first series included card games on Arithmetic, Geography, Riddles. and Useful Knowledge.

One player was designated the "preceptor" and the other players were "scholars." The preceptor would ask questions and go around the players until someone got the question right. Most right answers wins.

"Grandmama's Old Testament Questions & Answers" card game had 100 question cards, an instruction sheet, and an answer booklet which were packaged in a paper covered cardboard box.

127784.description: In Suspend, you want to be the first player to get rid of your share of the 24 notched, rubber-tipped wire pieces that come with the game. How do you get rid of them? Throw them away? Hide them under a cushion? No – you must hang them from a shared tabletop stand, using only one hand to place the piece on an unoccupied space. If anything touches the table after you place your piece, you must remove and reposition it; if anything falls off, you have to keep those pieces and try to hang them again on future turns. The first player to suspend all of her pieces wins!
127784.name: Suspend
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 21 - Puttin' On the Blitz
Episode 4 - The Great Outdoors

127785.name: Johnny on the Pony
127785.description:
The game is basically a children's race game with no decisions. In this regard it is like Chutes and Ladders. The theme is riding your pony from start to the finish line.

There is a twist on the Chutes and Ladders type game. There are two card decks from which a player may get a move card on his turn. However the player must flip a supplied "coin" to see if he gets a card from the Johnny stack or the pony stack. having each player flip a coin would thus make "individual" luck come into play as opposed to both players just playing against a randomized deck.

The game had 4 riders and horses. It cam in a cardboard box that was somewhat like a pizza box.

127786.description:
An expansion set of player cards only, published separately from the base game each year. Gamers who already owned the base game (which included a full set of cards for a year) could buy the new cards for the previous season, and play the teams without having to buy a base game again.

The package held a set of large perforated sheets for all the actual NFL teams and players, using revised statistical information based on the season passed (so the 1992 published set had the 1991 year stats). Some of the index cards included new rules or clarifications.

The packaging made it very clear that you needed the base game, so if you didn't know what it was about "it behooves you to gently place this package back on the shelf and purchase the complete game".
127786.name: Statis Pro Football AFC/NFC Player Cards

127787.name: Giant Wheel Old Maid Game
127787.description: Basically this is a children's game which is a combination of Bingo and Old Maid. Instead of doing a blind draw, each player spins a wheel on his move to determine which picture to cover up on his 'bingo" card. If he spins the Old Maid, then he takes possession of the Old Maid token. When the first player completes his card, then whoever is holding the old Maid marker loses.

127788.name: Giant Wheel Picture Bingo
127788.description: Basically a Bingo game with a "spin." The six 4x4 playing boards are printed onto a large roll-up mat. Rather than a blind draw, on his turn each player spins a wheel to find the picture he can cover up. First person to complete a line of 4 wins. on his board wins.

127789.name: Wandering Monsters High School (2nd Edition)
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Family Game - Nominee
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 72 - tremulus, Legacy: Life Among the Ruins, Tweaks, Orc Hospital
127789.description:
From publisher blurb:

Does that cute medusa in Lair Economics really have her eye on you? Can you possibly get your grade up in Common Tongue class while spending so much time in Slamball practice? Who's bringing the cupcakes for the Undead Poets Society bake sale? And what do you really learn when you sign up for Armor class?

Wandering Monsters High School is a humorous fantasy roleplaying game where you take the roles of monsters going to school. Inspired by wacky teen comedies and the silliest bits of fantasy gaming, WMHS is an all-ages game that anyone who's attended school can relate to.

127790.name: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang  Movie Quiz
127790.description:
This was a licensed game with a tie to the movie of the same name. It had Dick Van Dyke on the box top. It is essentially a movie trivia game.

Sheets of questions are supplied, and the player gives an answer then completes the circuit to show the correct answer for that question by turning on a light.

127791.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 21 - Jun 1990)
127791.description: Contents to be listed in Articles

127792.name: Atelier Ayesha: The Alchemist of Dusk
127792.description:
Atelier Ayesha stars a lonely girl who runs an alchemy studio. After her grandfather died, Ayesha’s younger sister Nio disappeared when she was gathering herbs. One day, Ayesha sees Nio walking through ruins which starts her journey. Overcoming sadness is one of the game’s themes and players will see Ayesha grow as she writes diary entries.

The goal of this game is to reunite Ayesha Altugle with her younger sister Nio who went missing while gathering herbs. Atelier Ayesha takes place in a new world separate from the Arland saga where the art of alchemy is out of style. Most people forgot about it and Ayesha lives in an ever changing world.

Source: Wikipedia, "Atelier Ayesha: The Alchemist of Twilight Land", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127793.name: Rat Patrol Spin-To-Win
127793.description:
Each player has a top to spin on the board which has holes. When a player's top lands in a hole he scores points. The player gets four spins per turn.

Two ways to win. First on total points. the first player to reach 400 points wins.

Second way to win is score points in each turn for one of the four weapons ( anti-aircraft gun - 25 pts, gun truck - 10 pts, plane - 50 pts, and tank - 75 pts) to capture. First player to capture all four weapons wins.

127794.name: Our Defenders
127794.description: Rules state - "Our Defenders Game can be player by two, three, and four players. Each players selects a different cutup figure [ie 1 of 4] and separates same. The first player spins spinner. If it points to figure he selected, he takes one cutup part of figure. Next player spins and plays in same manner. If spinner points to a figure other than the one selected, player loses his turn. The game is continued in this manner until one player has completed his figure. The First player completing his figure is the winner."

127795.name: Dragon (Issue 404 - Oct 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Class Acts: The Assassin - Secrets of the Ninja
Class Acts: The Runepriest - Runepriests of Kara-Tur
Unearthed Arcana: A Matter of Honor
127795.description:
Table of contents:

Editorial
The Seven Styles
Class Acts: The Assassin - Secrets of the Ninja
Class Acts: The Runepriest - Runepriests of Kara-Tur
Character Themes: Fringes of Kara-Tur
Character Themes: Samurai and Yakuza
Monk Basics
The Ecology of the Hengeyokai
Unearthed Arcana: A Matter of Honor
D&D Alumni
Confessions of a Full-Time Wizard
Dragonmith

127796.name: Scottorum Malleus
127796.description:
A Medieval miniature wargame for armies consisting of 10-15 units. Game play is driven by an orders chart, each player choosing a set number of actions for the turn (such as Shoot, Battle, Charge, or Move).

The rules are short, simple and give quick games. Unit types are abstracted, so all knights perform in a similar way, all missile troops are similar, and so on.

The game may be played with 6, 10, 15, or 28mm models or with counters.

127797.name: Dragon (Issue 405 - Nov 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Character Themes: Born from the Feywild
Character Themes: Heroes of the Moonshaes
Class Acts: Swordmage - The Winterguard of Cendriane
History Check: Rary the Traitor and the Circle of Eight
Nerathi Legends: The Knights of Rethmil
127797.description:
Table of contents:

Editorial
History Check: Rary the Traitor and the Circle of Eight
Heroic Tier Rituals
Character Themes: Heroes of the Moonshaes
Character Themes: Born from the Feywild
Making Race Count, Part 2
Class Acts: Swordmage - The Winterguard of Cendriane
Nerathi Legends: The Knights of Rethmil
Confessions of a Full-Time Wizard
D&D Alumni

127798.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In front of you lies the untouched soil of Germany. No track is cutting through its plains, no station is telling of the great industrial progress – but you are about to change that.

In Express 01, you can invest in the construction and upgrading of railway lines and build stations for different companies. When you upgrade such a station, you may reassign it to another company. Your main focus is the acquisition of shares, and as soon as shares are issued, trains can run on behalf of the companies. This way money will be distributed to the shareholders and you get new capital. So keep an eye on the other players to earn money or obstruct their opportunities.

The game ends after the round in which a certain number of Base Cards is upgraded or a certain number of decks are used up. The player who managed to gain the most capital wins.
127798.name: Express 01

127799.name: Dragon (Issue 406 - Dec 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Agents of Evil: The Infernal Prince
Eye on Dark Sun: Ur Draxa
Eye on the Realms: Xraunrarr Shall Triumph
Nerathi Legends: The Rangers of Cernall
127799.description:
Table of Contents:

Editorial
Secrets of the Dark Fey
Character Themes: The Black-Hearted Knave
Agents of Evil: The Infernal Prince
Paragons of Fey Valor
Eye on the Realms: Xraunrarr Shall Triumph
Eye on Dark Sun: Ur Draxa
Eye on Eberron: The Trust
Confessions of a Full-Time Wizard
Nerathi Legends: The Rangers of Cernall

127800.name: Quick-Quiz: Fussball – EURO 2008 Edition
127800.description:
108 game cards with 500 questions and 500 answers about Euro 2008 soccer cup.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

Contents:

108 playing cards,
notepad and pencil

127801.name: Nebraska's Trivia
127801.description:
Nebraska's Best Trivia was developed to bring hours of fun while teaching interesting facts about the great State of Nebraska. Nebraska's Best Trivia is designed for any number of players; individual play or 2 to 4 teams of 2 to 4 players on each team.

The object of the game is to complete a score card by answering trivia questions from five different categories and be the first to cross the finish line with a completed score card. But watch out! You must avoid setbacks and potential disasters brought on by your opponents as they try to complete their score cards and cross the finish line before you.

127802.name: Donald Duck's Dolle Daden
127802.description:
Translated from Dutch:
"You know Scrooge McDuck loves his money. On the board you can see him running in anger around the tree. He is mad because the Beagle boys turned on the windmill and now his money is blown away. He tries to catch the money. He now gives a reward to the player who stops the windmill. Donald, Huey, Dewey and Louie would like to profit this chance. Therefor they travel to the windmill. Winner is the player who reaches the windmill first."

The game is a roll and move game with some extra's. At the start of the game players receive two planks. While travelling to the windmill players must cross the water and use these planks. When they roll a 3 or a 6 they can pick up a plank from the board.

127803.name: Bonkan
127803.description:
In Bonkan, players are explorers traveling through ruins and looking for anything they can find. Players will discover both artifacts and traps, then must decide to go on exploring or escape.

Every round, each player decides to continue or exit the expedition. If you choose to continue, you draw a card. Items found have weights, from heavy treasures to lighter artifacts (which are useful against traps). Each player that continues has to contend with this accumulating weight. Disasters and traps also come up in play, and a player can get stuck in the cave if they get too heavy or get stuck in a trap. Players who don't make it out score nothing for their treasures.

At the end of the game round, the player with the most points wins.

127804.name: New York Quiz & Trivia
127804.description:
New York Quiz is a game for anyone who has ever visited New York City, or dreams of doing so! With 170 tricky questions and fascinating facts about the Big Apple, everyone will find something to tickle their brain cells with. It's the perfect way to warm up to a coming New York trip, or remember it once you are back home.

There are 2 question in each card and answers on backside.
Player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point.

127805.name: Anno Domini: Hannover & Deutschland
boardgamefamily: Cities: Hanover or Hannover (Lower Saxony, Germany)
127805.description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year in which it happened on the other.
Each player receives nine of these cards, and may only look at the descriptions. Each player in turn puts a card on the table, trying to put them in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.
Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure and are hard to date.

Part of the Anno Domini series.

127806.name: Electric Tipsy Towers
127806.description: Dexterity game where the players are trying to build a tower out of wooden beams. The "twist" on the "normal" game is that the tower is built on a rotating turntable. Whoever knocks any part of the tower down loses.

127807.name: Crusader Kings II: Sword of Islam
127807.description:
User Summary

This DLC adds the muslims as playable characters and nations. It introduces new gameplay mechanics (e.g. Decadence, multiple wives) and further improves the combat system. A lot of new events and GUI improvements increase the value of the expansion.

First expansion of Crusader Kings II

127808.name: Thinking Races: Heroes of Iron and Steel
127808.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thinking Races Series provides new takes on the familiar races of fantasy gaming, and over the course of the line, will introduce several dozen new player races and sub-races to the game. This volume focuses on heroes not made from flesh and blood. The heroic races in this volume are made from sterner, more noble matter: gold, steel, titanium, chrome and iron. Some of the new races in this sourcebook are elemental beings, others are constructs. All are something more than human, more even than Dwarf or Elf.

The races in this sourcebook are created by the blending of arcana and technology, and the only two races in this sourcebook actually made of something like skin and bone - the Kobolds and Earthborn Humans - are defined by their mastery of technology and industriousness.

The Forgeblood Feats presented at the end of this sourcebook were originally presented in 2005's Mega-Feats: New Paths to Victory. The new version printed here has been updated to conform to the changes made to fantasy gaming by the release of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Relatively minor changes were made, and if you have the original version of these feats, they still work fine.

Steel yourself for battle.

127809.name: Thinking Races: What Savage Beasts
127809.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thinking Races Series provides new takes on the familiar races of fantasy gaming, and over the course of the line, will introduce several dozen new player races and sub-races to the game. This volume focuses on the most savage and brutal races in the campaign, those player races who have felt the lash of a master’s whip and know what it’s like to fight for their lives on the arena sand.

The clash of steel.

The scent of blood.

Conflict and pain; muscle and power. Life and death, separated only by the thin edge of a broadsword.

The savage races are defined by conflict and tempered by violence.

The races in this book all have one thing in common: they are all monsters of one breed or another. They battle in the arena, pitting their lives against one another for the thrill of the gathered crowd. They wage great wars and lay waste to entire kingdoms; they burn, rape and pillage where and when they choose. Some monsters in humanoid shape find work as mercenaries or rise to become savage warlords, their brutality only increasing with each new conquest.

Power defines a monster’s existence. Might makes right makes might. The savage power in their limbs and running through their veins defines these monsters’ existence, and separates them fundamentally from the more civilized races.

Many of these savage races share a special connection to humanity. The Brass Men should have been human, until it became more profitable to transform these powerfully built slaves into something inhuman. The Deershee are a legion of cloned warriors born from human blood and ingenuity. Half Orcs are humanity’s bastard children, sometimes feared, sometimes loved. And the Vier… the Vier hate us with all that is in them.

127810.name: Thinking Races: Freeform Anthropomorphica
127810.description:
From publisher blurb:

Why be human?

Why not choose the agility and feral grace of the wolf instead? The sensuality of the cat or the strength and ferocity of the warthog? The airborne agility of the hawk, or the impenetrable exoskeleton of the rhino beetle? Anthropomorphic heroes and villains are nothing new to gamers.

Dungeons & Dragons has included animal species from its inception: jackal-like gnolls, warthog faced orcs and ogres, a myraid of cat, spider and birdlike species, and shapeshifting druids that blend human and animal traits.
Whitewolf's Werewolf the Apocalypse put a supernatural spin on eco-terrorism and furry/otherkin culture, pawning a whole generation of lycanthrope heroes and vigilantes. Sci-fi games from Wing Commander to Robotech include a cat-like race in homage to the Kzin, one of the most recognizable species in science fiction.

Gamers of my generation grew up watching anthropomorphic great-cats battle evil on the Thundercats, watched the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles battle the Foot Clan every afternoon. From the camp of Biker Mice from Mars to the exactingly researched samurai epic, Usagi Yojimbo, gamers looking to play anthropomorphic heroes have a wide source of inspiration to draw from.

The Freeform Anthropomorphica system can quickly generate new alien species, demi-human or metahuman races for fantasy gaming, uplifted animals, genetically engineered mutants and animalistic superheroes, as well as magical beasts: magical crossbreeds, even unfortunates like Arachnae, who are cursed with animalistic form by the gods.or metahuman races for fantasy gaming, uplifted animals, genetically engineered mutants and animalistic superheroes, as well as magical beasts: magical crossbreeds, even unfortunates like Arachnae, who are cursed with animalistic form by the gods.

No matter their origin, Freeform Anthropomorphica is designed to produce a fully customizable anthropomorphic character suitable for use as a PC in both fantasy and future campaigns.

Anthropomorphic characters are invariably bipedal, roughly human-scale and humanoid, and are intelligent enough to communicate with other characters and interact meaningfully with other players. The Freeform Anthropomorphica system produces characters without any Level Adjustment or ECL modifier, making them suitable for easy inclusion in most games. Build an animalistic humanoid superhuman inspired by reality's unparalleled bio-diversity or inspired by your favorite anthropomorphic heroes and villains. Quickly cobble together new player races or alien species before tonight's game.

With over 43,300,000 possible combinations of Orders, Racial Traits and Templates, you can build exactly the creature you've always wanted to play.

Creating an anthropomorphic character is simply an extended version of the character creation process already familiar to gamers. Rather than choosing a starting race, an anthropomorph's player selects an Order, or generic category of animals. An Anthropomorph's Order determines racial ability score modifiers, racial skill bonuses, and the creature's favored class.

Once an Order is chosen, the Anthropomorph begins to take shape. The creature can be further customized by adding a variety of advantages and drawbacks. Some advantages are more common in some Orders than others, and this diversity is reflected in the "Favored Racial Traits" mechanic described within the product.

This volume is fully compatible with the Pathfinder Role Playing Game.

Add some non-human fun to your game!

127811.name: Thinking Races: Diverse Humanity
127811.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thinking Races Series provides new takes on the familiar races of fantasy gaming, and over the course of the line, will introduce several dozen new player races and sub-races to the game. This volume takes a look at the most familiar (yet least described) fantasy race: Humans.

Humans are among the greatest summoners and magic users in history, ascending to arcane mastery in a single lifetime; while many of the longer lived races require generations, or even centuries to make similar discoveries. From the moment of their birth, the ambitious human race is ascending towards something greater. Great liches and powerful, god-touched heroes hail from the various races of mankind with greater reliability than they do from among the other races.

This Thinking Races PDF gives you new things to do with the "same old" humans! Various tribes that exist with the Human family are presented here, along with new racial traits, civilizations, Gods, feats and flavor. You'll never play the same-old Human again.

127812.description:
From the Introduction:

The Alliance War Host army book requires the Star Confrontation rules book in order to play. The Alliance War Host uses a few extremely powerful warriors in battlesuits to dominate the battlefield. Their advanced battlesuits make each troop incredibly deadly and tough as nails.
127812.name: Star Confrontations: Alliance War Host

127813.description:
Bitter Heights: The Battle of Mitla Pass: October 29-31, 1956, is a low-complexity game on the battle for Mitla Pass during the 1956 Arab-Israeli War. The Israelis were to take and hold the Pass to prevent Egyptian forces from reinforcing their counterparts to the east, as well as establish a credible force that could threaten the Suez Canal. This would provide the pretext for Great Britain and France to intervene and take the crucial waterway back from Egyptian control.

The battle would come to represent the confused and tragic aspects of this war. The Israelis underestimated the strength of their opposition, the indecisive actions of their British and French allies upon which this operation depended, and the diplomatic victory Nasser and the Arab Allies would realize despite the military defeats they sustained. General Sharon’s controversial decision, to attack and take control of the pass in disobedience of direct orders, led to high losses in a fight that did nothing to further the Israeli cause.

As the Israeli player you will have to keep your losses low, while keeping hold of the roadway through the pass, as the Egyptian player you want the Israeli's to pay a high price.

Activation takes place by the use of a deck of cards, similar to the Pocket Battle Games by ATO. This creates the chaos of war that makes play unpredictable and interactive.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 3 hours
Area: 1 inch equals 2 miles / 3.2 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Army

Game Inventory:
One 11x17" full color map
One dual-side printed un-mounted countersheet (90 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 4-page rulebook
One Player Aid Chart

Player Provided: One 6-sided die

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2 to 3 hours
127813.name: Bitter Heights: The Battle of Mitla Pass: October 29-31, 1956
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 46: Paul Rohrbaugh of High Flying Dice Games

127815.name: Siegreich voran!
127815.description:
Victorious advance!

A new game from our Air Force by H. Kallenberger from the collection "Scholz's artistic games".

This game is adapted from real live and provides a fairly accurate picture of the use of air power. In it the combat units (bombers) are used to advance far into the enemy rear. These are heavy machines, suitable for carry large bomb loads over long distances.

The goal is to destroy the HQ of the opponent by hitting it with a bomber(only a bomber). Play also ends if the one of the player's HQ's has no place to move or if the player has lost all his bombers.

127816.name: Used Car Lot
127816.description:
From the publishers website:

It’s nice when you can spend the time and the money to pick the exact right vehicle to suit your needs, but time and money are two luxuries shadowrunners don’t always have. Sometimes you need just two characteristics in a vehicle: It’s cheap, and it moves.
Used Car Lot provides an assortment of vehicles for Shadowrun so that runners can have plenty of options, from the practical, affordable Ford Americar to the ridiculously luxurious Rolls Royce Phaeton. Motorcycles, sports cars, limousines, and trucks, and more—they’re all here. A lot of the vehicles here may not be state-of-the-art, but they’ll get you from point A to point B, they may help you blend in with the rest of the populace, and they’ll save you a few nuyen while you’re at it. Because a good shadowrunner knows how to use fancy toys, but a great shadowrunner knows how to be awesome with simpler tools.

127817.name: L.A. Noire: The Complete Edition
127817.description:
User Summary

The Complete Edition contains all the released DLC. Enhancements for the PC include keyboard remapping and gamepad functionality, increased fidelity, improved graphical enhancements, and stereoscopic 3D support.

127818.name: Brigand's Nest
127818.description:
Authors Blurb -

Brigand's Nest is a 1st Ed. compatible dungeon for a small party of 1st Level characters, and playable in a single session.

The village of Ragentop (population 405) has become the subject of a series of raids by Brigand's who descend from the nearby hills. They have raised a bounty to pay the brave souls who rid them of this menace.

This product is a micro scenario that prints on a single sheet of paper and folds into a little booklet using the "PocketMod" system. It'll fit in your shirt pocket!

127819.name: Sea Chess
127819.description:
Sea Chess is a board game, like Chess, or Checkers. Chess, however, is a game that interprets Medieval land warfare while Sea Chess interprets a modern Naval Battle. Every Sea Chess game piece represents a warship. Both players get 24 game pieces representing 3 battleships, 4 cruisers, 8 destroyers and 9 escorts. Each type of "ship" moves freely about the board with its own characteristic motion, speed and direction. The "ships" are engaged in dynamic moving action until sunk and you can watch all of the action.

In Sea Chess there is a gradual "sinking" instead of "jumping" or "taking" pieces. A game piece moves into range and "fires". A roll of the dice determines a successful hit. Each type of "ship" has its own characteristic striking force and range. Pegs are placed in the pieces to record successful hits. When the holes are full, the piece has been "sunk". Since a peg marks each successful hit, you can keep track of how much damage you are doing to your opponent's ships.

READY REFERENCE CARDS included with the game give you a neat summary to keep by your side as you play so you do not have to keep looking into the rule book for speed, direction, striking force, etc.

RANGE GAUGES are provided to help you determine what ships are in range and which are not. Soon you will be able to tell just by looking which ships are in range.

You develop the strategy! You make the plans! You decide whether to make the first attack or prepare a devastating counter-attack!

127820.name: Uprising
127820.description:
From the game page on The Game Crafter

For too long the Meeples have lived under the boot of the mighty Regime. You have been pushed around and mistreated while the Regime grows rich off your toil. No longer! The day has come to rise up and take control of your fate. The day has come for Uprising!

Uprising is a semi-cooperative game for 2-4 players who take the role of rebel groups rising up against the vicious Regime. Will you be able to work together to overthrow your oppressors, or will you turn on the others to try to become number one?

Summary of Game Play

The board is a grid, where each cell ("sector") can be controlled by a player, by the regime, or by nobody. Each turn, players draw tiles indicating where they can take actions, such as attacking or reinforcing. After all the players have taken their turns, the regime takes 3 automated actions in random sectors. Each battle can be fought with military power, or with popularity.

The game ends when any player (or the regime) reaches a target score, based on popularity and sectors controlled. At that point, the force with the highest score wins, and if the regime is highest, all the players lose. In the standard rules, players can directly attack each other or temporarily align with the regime. There is a fully-cooperative variant, where players face a stronger regime.

127821.name: Mythender
rpghonor: 2012 Indie RPG Award - Best Free Game - Winner
2012 Indie RPG Award - Best Production - Runner-Up
2012 Indie RPG Award - Game of the Year - Runner-Up
127821.description:
From the Introduction

Mythender is high-action adventure game where you play amazing, Mythic heroes— called Mythenders—who travel the Mythic World to destroy its gods and monsters. Because, hey, why not? It’s all about leaping off of mountains with your massive, flaming sword drawn and splitting open a giant’s face. (At least, it was a face before you showed up.)

Most of will you take on the role of a Mythender, a single man, woman, or child turned into a force of destruction. One of you will play the Mythmaster, taking on the role of the Mythic World and everyone in it: gods and monsters, powerless mortals, and even the land itself.

You’ll tell the stories of slaughtering gods in a way that goes beyond just killing them— you unmake them, turning them from beings that rule mortals into legends people vaguely remember. This is an Ending, and only you Mythenders have the power to do it.

You’ll tell the stories of interacting with mortals that barely understand you, seeing you just as they see gods and monsters: terrible beings that have far more power than they can imagine. It’s easy to break Thor’s jaw, but getting a little girl to smile instead of being frightened by your glorious visage? That will be your greatest challenge.

You’ll tell the stories of struggling against becoming gods yourselves. You live in the vicious cycle of apotheosis and decide, as you must take on the corrupting powers of the Mythic World in order to End its gods. Each time you take more of that much-needed power, you take a step away from your mortal soul and a step closer to becoming a Myth.

Or you’ll tell the stories of how you ignore all that humanity business and go pedal to the fucking metal, diving headfirst into the heart of Myth, leaving corpses & cultists in your wake. And eventually forcing your comrades to murder your Mythic ass.

127822.name: Genso Suikoden I & II
127822.description:
User Summary

Genso Suikoden I & II includes the first and second part of this truly amazing, highly atmospheric role playing adventure.

127823.description:
An LPS bonus mini-game, Terrible Swift Swordfish is a solitaire simulation of the Royal Navy's bold and devastating attack on the ships of the Regia Marina in the port of Taranto during the night of November 11-12, 1940.

In two waves, the player send his Swordfish carrier-based biplanes laden with either torpedos or bombs to attack Italian ships or bomb port facilities respectively. Damage inflicted is determined by chit-pull (or dice rolling in the case of flak).

As additional Swordfish enter the map on their pre-designated bombing runs, Italian flak and anti-torpedo defenses grow more coordinated and deadly.

The player attempts to maximize his Victory Points by sinking ships and bombing facilities, all while trying to avoid the loss of his Swordfish Biplanes.
boardgameversion: Against the Odds Annual Bonus edition 2011
127823.name: Terrible Swift Swordfish

127824.name: Forsaken Lands
127824.description:
User Summary:

Double-sided poster map. One side contains "Swamp Caves" and the other contains "Desert Sanctum". Maps use a one-inch square grid and are 22 by 34.

127825.name: Mass Transit II
127825.description:
User Summary:

Double-sided poster map. One side contains "Cargo Docks" and the other contains "Offworld Transport Facility". Maps use a one-inch square grid and are 22 by 34.

127826.name: Forsaken Lands II
127826.description:
User Summary:

Double-sided poster map. One side contains "Badlands" and the other contains "Deep Caverns". Maps use a one-inch square grid and are 22 by 34.

127827.name: Mass Transit III
127827.description:
User Summary:

Double-sided poster map. One side contains "Boarding Action" and the other contains "Strike Force Carrier". Maps use a one-inch square grid and are 22 by 34.

127828.name: Mass Transit IV
127828.description:
User Summary:

Double-sided poster map. One side contains "The Nova Eclipse" and the other contains "Offworld Docking Port". Maps use a one-inch square grid and are 22 by 34.

127829.description:
Immortal is a strategy game of warring mythologies, combining area control and card battle play. The war of the gods has begun... Born from the dreams and nightmares of mankind, mythic beings are gathering forces to crush their enemies. They have put their fate in the hands of mere mortals like yourself, granting you the power to lead them to victory. Capture your opponents’ forces, turn their powers against them, and forge your own legend!

In Immortal, ancient gods, heroes, and monsters battle for control over mythic realms. 2 to 4 players assume command of powerful pantheons summoned from world mythologies - Master Set One features the Norse, Greek, Japanese, Celtic, Egyptian, and Native American pantheons. Each pantheon of character cards offers unique abilities and strategies to be mastered. Battles take place on a battlefield created from modular board tiles, representing the nexus of mythical realms. The goal of the game is to control the most cards on the battlefield by capturing your opponents’ cards and defending your own.

During the game, players take turns placing their character cards on the spaces of the board. Each card has a distinct combination of battle strengths, represented by numbers on its four edges. When a card is placed on a space adjacent to the north, south, east, or west edge of an opponent’s card, an attack begins and the strengths on the cards’ touching edges are compared. If the attacker’s strength is greater, then the defending card is successfully captured, giving the attacking player more control over the battlefield. Special abilities can influence the results of an attack, and set the board up for future combos by strengthening allies, weakening enemies, and bending the normal rules of the game.

After the first battle, players upgrade their pantheon decks with more powerful cards, and expand the battlefield with additional modular boards. Victory goes to the player who controls the most cards at the end of two battles. Game variants allow players to form teams, change the rules of engagement, or play faster matches. Once players have mastered the basic strategies of the game, they can mix and match characters from different pantheons to build their own custom decks. As Immortal evolves, more pantheons will be added from the myths and legends of distinct cultures. These expansions will introduce new boards and cards, and new abilities and playing styles to the game.
127829.name: Immortal
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 10: Interview with David Sanhueza
The Game of Crowd Funding David Sanhueza Interview 06-03-2015

127830.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 31 - Jul 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Active Measures: A Jolly (Roger) Good Time
Doing It My Way: Mongoose Traveller Lite: Simplifying Skill and Task Checks
In A Store Near You: Hot Judy and Ice Judy
Raconteurs' Rest: A Most Unfortunate War
Raconteurs’ Rest: Drop Out, Part Seventeen
The Shipyard: Earth Alliance Heavy Shuttle
127830.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #031: July 2012

Cover: Kenneth Fairclough

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from the Freelance Traveller web site.

127832.name: Abbey of the Golden Sparrow
127832.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Abbey of the Golden Sparrow" is the first in our line of “locale” supplements featuring information for players and Game Masters alike. Locales are places of interest that can be dropped into any fantasy campaign that help bring the setting to life for the already harried GM. "Abbey of the Golden Sparrow" is designed especially with an eye toward monk characters but there is no reason that another character class might not be living at or visiting the abbey (or make use of many of the new rules presented). No matter the class, players using this text will be able to give their characters that much more background which only enhances the roleplaying experience. Likewise, GMs will find plenty of plot hooks and adventure ideas that can occur either inside the abbey or outside, using the locale as a springboard for adventures nearby.

The supplement begins with a short narrative describing the typical life of an initiate at the abbey. This is followed by the locale’s physical description, history, two local myths, and sample doctrines. Then we get to the rules sections. New feats as well as new character traits are featured. Following these are a new special material (obsidian), three new magic items, and two signature NPCs of the abbey. In short, you get a grab bag of material that can be used together or separately without hindrance.

127833.name: Achievement Feats
127833.description:
From publisher blurb:

50 feats for your Pathfinder PC!

Achievement feats allow your character to grow his abilities as a direct result of his actions during a campaign. In order to qualify for these feats, he must first achieve a specific goal or set of goals that requires you to play him in a certain way or track certain elements of game play. Achievement feats may require a little more PC planning on your part but the rewards are well worth the extra effort. With the Beacon of Life achievement feat, for example, you must track the damage your channeling PC inflicts upon undead but, once a certain threshold is crossed, he can damage undead just by being near them!

127834.name: Achievement Feats: Volume 2
127834.description:
From publisher blurb:

Great heroes perform great deeds – whether saving the world from annihilation, discovering heretofore unknown continents and planes of existence, unearthing the mysteries of forgotten civilizations, or defending entire cities from hordes of undead. Such acts of heroism, and occasionally villainy, leave their marks upon the souls and bodies of these heroes. Achievement Feats Volume 2 details the in-game effects these grand heroics might have on a PC. This volume takes a slightly different approach than volume 1 in the series in that it requires little bookkeeping. It's a win-win for everyone!

127835.name: Superstructure
127835.description:
A building game where players are acquiring all of the elements the need to build a three-story tower. Players use cards to buy equipment from the stock -- H-beams and joints create substructures, and V-beams are used to build to the next story. The goal of the game is to be the first player to build a three-story building that consists of three substructures separated by V-beams, and a roof.

Game play consists of turns where players either buy materials, or use purchased materials to build building elements. Unbuilt raw materials are vulnerable to card-play from other players that may require them to give over unused materials, or may cause a player to return all unused materials to the supply. Additionally, some special action cards prevent a player from building until the player resolves a strike, either through the payment of money, or the play of a contract card.

127836.name: Band Together
127836.description:
User Summary

Band Together is an iPad game inspired by Lemmings and prominently endorsed by film director David Lynch. The game is about a slightly deranged kid who finds "bandies" living in a shoebox in his attic. Each level in the game is an "experiment" to see if the bandies can escape from some predicament (one of the early threats is the "thumbtack death machine"). Bandies can move individually or as a group, and can move left, right, or downward, but not up. The player must coordinate their moves to shepard them all to the exit in each level.

127837.name: Saturday Night 78
127837.description:
From the publisher's web site:

"New York City, 1978. Last year, the city endured the chaos of the blackout of ‘77 and the terror of the Son of Sam killings. This year, Studio 54 makes millions by giving beautiful plebs and dazzling celebrities a place to party at $20 a head. Condensed sweat rains from Studio 54’s mirrored-laminate ceiling—sweat evaporated from the brows of celebrities, maybe—and falls back on the dancers below.

This is a time of rock and disco, of reckless hedonism and casual sex, a time before consequences. Debauchees high on blow, poppers, or Quaaludes dance and laugh and lust and cry in swank clubs and dirty dives all over the city. Whoever your characters are in the daylight, come dark they transform into sordid stars or disco royalty, beautiful disasters or pitiable victors, ricocheting off each other into the glittering wreckage of imploded parties. Every Saturday night the city’s alight with spectacular fiascos.

127838.description:
From Spielbox Magazine:

Louis Armstrong is an additional leader for 7 Wonders: Leaders.

He gives 7 victory points at the end minus number of military victory tokens you have won.

The Card is only playable with 7 Wonders: Leaders, but may also be integrated along with the leaders of 7 Wonders: Cities
boardgameversion: Repos Production English / French / German edition
127838.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders – Louis

127839.description:
Mage Tower is a tower defense card game for 1-4 players that combines the frenzy of tower defense games with the replayability and customization of fantasy card games. Each game you make a unique deck from over 170 different spells and abilities. You and opponents pick from a selection of cards to build your deck. Focus on card combos, synergy, balanced energy costs, and watch out for your opponent's strategy!

During the game there are two decks: the Monster Deck and your customized Player Deck. Each turn monsters come out of the monster deck to attack you, and you use the cards from your Player Deck to deal damage to them, draw cards, mess with opponents, and more. There are also some subtle deck building elements with "Prize Cards" you can buy during the game to add to your deck. The first players to lose all their life from the monsters lose.
127839.name: Mage Tower, A Tower Defense Card Game

127840.name: The People vs. O.J. Simpson Trivia Game
127840.description:
Object of the Game: As an investigator, your job is leave your color start position and make your way, by answering questions, to the six locations on the map, and return to your position before your opponents do.

Possibly a prototype of a game that was to be sold and money raised was to be used for OJ Simpson's defense. The game may have been banned and/or rejected and never mass produced.

127841.name: Vietcong: Fist Alpha
127841.description:
Vietcong: Fist Alpha is an expansion pack for the computer game Vietcong. It was released in February 2004.

It is a prequel to Vietcong, occurring three months before the events of that game. In Fist Alpha you play the main character of Sergeant First Class Douglas Warren. All the members of the team from the original Vietcong are present initially except for Le Duy Nhut (Nick). The team's pointman and translator is Vietnamese Sergeant Nham Nguyen. He is killed in action during the attack on the Nui Pek base camp on 15 May 1967 and then he is replaced by Nhut.

Source: Wikipedia, "Vietcong: Fist Alpha", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127842.name: 1000 Faces: Villains & Scoundrels
127842.description:
From back cover:

1000 Faces: Book 1 of 4
Villains & Scoundrels

As a gamemaster, who hasn't experienced the last minute need for a fully-detailed NPC with stats, equipment and background information?

No matter what sort of villain you're looking for, this book has something for you. And best of all, each character is detailed and equipped, giving you the freedom to concentrate on the story, rather than the mechanics.

This books include:
250 characters, fully equipped and ready for action!
Detailed background and personalities for every character!
Ten villainous organizations!
Two new monsters!
A new prestige class suitable for powerful villains!
An quick reference guide to all of the characters in the book!

1000 Faces: Villains & Scoundrels fully details 250 villains ready to set foot in your fantasy world!

127843.name: Vietcong 2
127843.description:
Vietcong 2 is a tactical shooter PC game, developed by Pterodon and Illusion Softworks, published by 2K Games in October 2005, and set during the Vietnam War. It is the direct sequel to Vietcong.
The story takes place during the Tet Offensive in Hue. The player assumes the role of the disillusioned American MACV soldier Daniel Boone (named after the MACSOG Operation Daniel Boone). Boone is part of a coalition of international forces from Australia, New Zealand and Canada. The game also gives the player the ability to fight the war from another perspective as a young Vietcong recruit fighting before and during the Tet Offensive. This campaign is unlocked when the player has completed a certain part of the American campaign.

Source: Wikipedia, "Vietcong 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127844.name: Barbaric Traits
127844.description:
From publisher blurb:

Barbaric Traits presents 36 new character traits, and they're not just for barbarians. Indeed, these traits can help flesh out any character that hails from some savage frontier where honor and sharp steel matter more than manners and shiny coins.

Inspired by the works of Robert E. Howard and a certain cartoon barbarian with a sun sword, these 36 traits are divided evenly between Combat, Faith, Magic, and Social categories. Now your savage hero can become Blood-Mad, utter a Motivational Expletive, practice Poisonous Sorcery, or benefit from knowledge gained as a Barbaric Ambassador (to mention just one-ninth of the traits packed into this PDF).

127845.name: Eidolons Unbound
127845.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Summoner as presented in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Player’s Guide opens up an entirely new kind of magic, and offers players an entirely new perspective on the game’s major assumptions. Summoners are bound to a powerful outsider called an eidolon- a creature that bridges the gap between animal and god! This sourcebook builds on that strong foundation, providing a host of new options for Summoners, which will allow them to forge spiritual bonds with even more impressive eidolons.

127846.name: Fencing & Firearms
127846.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever watched a movie full of swashbuckling goodness and thought, "This would make a great game?" I know I have, and long before I played RPGs. As a kid, I loved Errol Flynn and Tyrone Powers. Many a Saturday was spent pretending to be Captain Blood, Robin Hood, or Zorro. And let's not forget the Three Musketeers, Jim Hawkins and Long John Silver, and, yes, even Don Quixote.

The roleplaying aspects of the swashbuckler genre work well-enough with any game system. Tongue-in-cheek humor and traded bon mots don't require game mechanics. Swashbuckling combat must be fast-paced, highly mobile, and full of flashy attacks. Unfortunately, the world's most popular roleplaying game's combat system doesn't score high marks in these areas.

Fencing & Firearms (F&F) respects the core mechanics of the game but still addresses widely perceived problems with the combat rules. F&F doesn't change racial traits, class features, or skills. It has as little impact on core rules feats as possible. Our primary goal is that DMs can take this book and drop it into their games with a minimal amount of work. F&F focuses on:

speeding up play,
keeping each player involved even when it's not his turn,
providing all players with more combat options, and
making combat maneuvers easier to use.




And this is just the first part of F&F. The second part deals with black powder weapons and how to use them with your game.

127847.name: Gazae et Monstri
127847.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 14-page PDF includes 6 magic items and 5 monsters drawn from Greek and Roman myth. Arm your fighter with the cesti of Eryx. Quest for Pandora's box. Trade blows with the mighty Antaeus, or match wits with the terrifying Python.

Magic Items

Cap of invisibility
Cesti of Eryx
Cuckoo scepter
Girdle of Hippolyta
Nemean Hide Armor
Pandora's Box




Monsters

Antaeus
Mare of Diomedes
Nemean Lion
Python
Stymphalian Bird

127849.name: Heroes of the Maze
127849.description:
From publisher blurb:

Macrotaur are children of Earth and stone, an ancient race of stone-born protectors and soldiers. Macrotaurs have protected the sacred spaces of the great subterranean cities for as long as the Dwarves have recorded their history.

The two races share ancient bonds of friendship and mutual aid. Macrotaurs are welcome in Dwarven city-fortresses and Dwarves are an equally common sight in Macrotaur holds. The alliance between the two races has allowed the Macrotaurs to evolve past the savagery and brutality that still traps their lesser cousins, the Minotaurs.

This release gives you everything you need to add the Macrotaur to your game as a player race; including personality, lands, gods and new racial feats.

127850.name: Learning Curve: Apprentice-Level Characters
127850.description:
From publisher blurb:

It seems like forever that you wanted to become an adventurer. You've been practicing with your hand-me-down sword and you've made darned sure that your friends have practiced their spells, prayers, and lockpicking. WIth everyone's parents at the winter gala, it's the perfect time to strike out as a team and right some wrongs in the city. With a little luck, you can do it. But never, ever, let dad find out and drag you home early.

Learning Curve allows players to adventure the way they should at beginner level--the hard way! With the rules in this pdf, you can now multiclass at 1st level in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or, if you choose, start your adventuring career as a half-level PC. There's also a brief discussion on how and why a GM might want to use these rules in his campaign.

127851.name: Mega-Feats Revisited
127851.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over 250 New Feats for the Pathfinder Role pLaying Game!

Mega-Feats: New Paths to Victory remains one of Skortched Urf Studio's best selling products. The release of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game presents us with a chance to revisit this weighty feat tome, revise the feats as necessary to bring them in line with how this generation of the game is played, and add new material to an already solid work.
